reviews.review_title: It's a mixed bag. There is definitely a lot to like in this but overall it's not as good as the first part.
reviews.content: The first half of KGF Chapter 2 feels like a continuation of the first film; the story of your favourite character' ascent continues; Yash continues to dominate everyone, his swag sweeps everyone off their feet with rip roaring music playing in the background. Everything seemed fine till the second half, where just like our lead character Rocky, the movie too loses direction and doesn't really know what to do next and where to go from here. KGF Chapter 2 is a mixed bag, unlike the first part. There is definitely a lot to like in this, a number of scenes will hit you hard but overall it's not as good as the first part.WHAT'S GOOD :1. KGF Chapter 2 once again takes you on a ride that is high on adrenaline and packed with goosebumps. The movie wastes no time in getting you back to the Kolar Gold Fields and gets you hooked right away with some stylish sequences powered by Ravi Basrur's electrifying background music. As a fan of KGF, you get everything that you could have asked for in the first hour of the film.2. The music continues to be the backbone of the film. When the song 'Toofan' explodes on screen, once again the movie makes you feel like a King who is ready to conquer the world. That one song is so powerful and impactful, as a viewer you feel like entering KGF and start dancing with Rocky and his friends. Outstanding work done by composer Ravi Basrur once again! Rest of the songs are also nice but would have been really enjoyable if they hadn't messed with the audio.3. Yash is the star of this show. As long as he is on screen, you have faith that something great will most certainly happen. His swag and charisma is unmatched by any other actor right now; his screen presence is that of an out an out superstar.4. The scene where Reena informs Rocky about her pregnancy has been done in a very creative way. Now this kind of situation has been written in movies a thousand times before and almost every time it's announced in the same manner; it's almost always a generic scene with no real artistic merit involved; but in KGF the way Reena informs Rocky about their child was something I had never seen before; powered by the beautiful background score of Ravi Basrur, that scene hit me hard emotionally because of Rocky's attachment to his mother. That was a very well written scene.5. The action sequences in this film are not as many as the first film, but every single one of them has been choreographed in an extremely stylish manner. Usually I am not a fan of action scenes, because they are all the same and boring and are used mostly to fill in the time; but KGF is different from the rest. Be it the car chase in the first half, or the Kalashnikov showdown with Adheera and his gang or the ultimate battle between Adheera and Rocky; every single one of them makes you sit up and watch because of how amazing they are.6. Raveena Tandon looked pretty solid as the Prime Minister. She looked like a more powerful opponent than Adheera. The movie took a political turn but didn't engage in a lot of political battle. The director kept it to a bare minimum and Rocky just decided to stay out of her path because she was a woman, and strong women are supposed to be worshipped? That argument felt rather strange, because by saying that he pretty much hung his boots. So, what was the point of this second part? I wish the director gave more meat to Ramika Sen's character and included a sub plot of the mind games played between Rocky and Ramika. Rocky is not just muscle power, he is also a sharp witted man; his battle with Ramika could have made for an interesting watch. Ramika going all out with Indian army to finish off Rocky was a bit too much, because it killed the scope for anything else to happen apart from KGF's downfall.7. The cinematography is as brilliant as the first part. The colour palette of KGF is very different from what we usually see in movies but it looks extremely beautiful. The portrayal of mining seems realistic, there is coal and dust everywhere, it's not a cosmetic world. The hard work of the art direction team has brought believability to the world of KGF.WHAT'S NOT SO GOOD :1. In order to create a bigger impact, the volume of the music has been kept very high and the sound has been distorted. It was a very bad idea, because the same music that received high praise in the first half of the film now became a nuisance. There was absolutely no need of it, the music was fine as it is, it was good enough to excite the viewers, but now it was just irritating to the ears. There was no need for this over the top approach.2. After the second half, the movie loses a sense of direction, just like Rocky. Rocky wanted to climb up the ladder and become the biggest player of the game, which he becomes but then he doesn't really know where to stop or where to go from there; which seems odd because Rocky may not be playing by the rules of the book, but he never comes across as stupid or suicidal. He always understood the struggles of poor people, and after reaching KGF he was completely transformed. The painful existence of people deeply affected him and he even risked his own life just to save a blind old man. So how did he turn into a crazy maniac who cared about nothing but gold, even more than human life? That whole concept of Rocky going after infinite amount of gold just because he promised his mother didn't come across as very convincing or interesting.3. Courage and stupidity are not the same. Rocky is a strong man, we know that but he's not a superman, so why would he go into Adheera's den to fight alone without a gun? He could have easily got himself killed and it would have been such a lame and foolish death for a visionary like him. It was a simple case of writers going for something over the top. This is what happens when you indulge into too much chest thumping; you stop using your brain. Also, when every member of Adheera's gang had a gun, why were they running with it towards Rocky to hit him instead of firing at him? Were they under some kind of spell that made them see their guns as iron rods?4. Till the first half, the movie was quite enjoyable but as soon as the political battle began, it turned into a generic gangster film that had nothing extraordinary to offer. Rocky walking with a swag and people getting scared of him can be equated with the icing of the cake, but it can never act as a substitute for the actual cake; that will always remain a compelling screenplay, which went missing in the second half of the film.5. Srinidhi Shetty had nothing much to do apart from looking gorgeous in every single frame. Her equation with Rocky was also a little unclear. Towards the end of the first film it was quite clear that she was aware of Rocky being alive, was proud of him and had developed feelings for him; but in the second part their relationship almost started from a scratch. Did the director forget that Reena had fallen in love with Rocky in the first part itself ?6. Sanjay Dutt as Adheera looks menacing but doesn't do much in the film. His role is also more like an extended cameo. For the most part, Adheera remains confined to the background nursing the wounds inflicted on his body and his ego by Rocky. Now that doesn't sound like a powerful villain. What made me laugh was Adheera shouting and roaring, after his gang's showdown with team Rocky powered by Kalashnikov's; was he expecting some kind of fire to come out of his mouth ? Also, how did Adheera manage to walk through fire? Was he a Targaryen ? Going unnecessarily over the top was a key problem with this film.7. I can understand that perhaps Rocky lost all interest in his life after his final showdown with Adheera, he had no one in his life; but wouldn't it have been better if he had distributed the gold among the people who had dedicated their life, sweat, blood and tears in working day in and day out to dig for all that gold? Why not do something for them ? What did they get out of it ? He promised his mother that he would get all the gold for her, he didn't promise to throw it all in the ocean. Unless there is more to it, and director Prashant Neel has some explanation for it that he wishes to answer in some future film, it's safe to say that it wasn't really a wise move to throw it all away under the water.8. The children in the first film were almost the narrators of the events taking place in KGF, and all of them acted really well. In this film, none of them are there and their role has been reduced to a bare minimum.9. This part doesn't have the emotional depth that the first part had. The first part was not just mindless action, there was a well layered storyline about an underdog rising the ranks to become the biggest player of the game, we were all rooting for this character and felt the deep connection that he had with his mother. The first part did a good job of depicting that emotional storyline, but the second part just couldn't connect to the viewers on an emotional level.

I really enjoyed kgf chapter 1 in theater. I fell in love with some scenese and specially the background music. With so much excitement i went to watch kgf chapter 2 and i feel disappointed. Only the story and mass is better than the chapter 1. I don't know why they mixed all themes and then bent it into one and played it so loudly in the theaters. The music was so unique in part one but in this case i can't able to differenciate the themes of characters. Dialogues were so pure. Every character in the film seems like waiting for giving their solo dialogues so that rocky can give entry in slow-mo. Hugely disappointed.

Chapter 2 is nothing compared to chapter 1. There are only a few scenes that made this film worth watching. Sanjay Dutt seems waste in the whole film; Just his look is dangerous but in the script nothing more than a killer of Reena. Action sequences should have been long and continued instead of having a black screen every 1 second when you tried to understand 'what's going on?'. Chapter 2 fails to create an impact like the previous one. The trailer was Mind-blowing but wish I could say this for the film.

KGF Chapter 2 is not a perfect film but it is definitely a mass feast for movie lovers. Don't go into this movie expecting a lot of depth but instead for the emotional highs and the adrenaline rush. That adrenaline rush barely drops anywhere in the film, kudos to Prashant Neel, Ravi Basrur and other technicians for being able to do that.As Rocky, Yash just owns the character and it's hard to see anyone else in those shoes. Great performance for the scope of the film. Sanjay Dutt was good as Adheera and he performed well but Adheera's character could have been better written, the confrontation scenes between Adheera and Rocky leave a little more being desired from the audience. The two having the other fallen and giving one another a second chance comes off as too clear of cinematic liberty and after the second confrontation, Adheera doesn't seem as powerful maybe they could have use other action pieces with different characters instead of early confrontations where they almost kill each other and let the other go. The main big bad and the show stealer in my opinion was Raveena Tandon as Ramika Sen. Those confrontation between Rocky and her and the power plays made by Rocky were the main highlights of the film. The ending is another highlight and may be one of the best endings in a massy film. The power moves from Rocky and the showcase of how he maintains his power and uses the power in KGF make KGF Chapter 2 a delight. Prakash Raj as Anant Nag's son was a good entry and provided a different look at the story.Overall a movie with great elevations and an adrenaline rush. Don't think too much and don't go picking apart the story for depth and all bc u would be disappointed, the movie intends to give u an exhilarating experience and delivers on that note with some minor inconsistencies here and there.

reviews.review_title: The scale is huge and the stakes are bigger than Chapter 1
reviews.content: Rating - 7.5In one scene , Rocky says " This is a new game of chess, the way of play remains the same but only the king is replaced ". This kind of sums up the entire movie. In chapter 2, Rocky is the new Sulthan to the KGF and the story revolves around how he defends his throne. Cinematography, Music and the elevations are the most positive aspects of the film. Fights are choreographed better than that of the first part and the villains are better too.The issue is with the edit pattern which is trailer-like or fan-made edit like pattern which might work out for a scene or two but the entire movie is cut like that. Also the heroine characterization is not written properly. I personally felt that both KGF 1 and 2 had good elevation scenes but these elevations alone do not make a movie , a well written one.

The direction and story telling keeps us engaged. The character of Adheera played by Sanjay Dutt is killing... Dialogue delivery of each cast is perfect. Overall conclusion - KGF 2 is a must watch movie.

This movie all about bullets and bloodshed.No scope for acting , screenplay is erratic, sentiment seems forced. Have to admit few dialogues worked.They did make joke of all the laws of Physics. May give goosebumps to masses but all that bloodshed is total turnoff for me.

It's rare for a sequel to outperform the first part in movies but that has come true for KGF. Chapter 2 was comparatively better than chapter 1. Amazing script, Amazing performance by all actors and excellent cinematography and sound mix . Big thumps up to the team KGF.

This movie just let me go crazy in theaters.Full of goosebumps 🔥🔥🔥🔥💜
The action sequences like Rocky vs Adheera was amazing .It was something high level which just driven my mind.I have a great respect to the whole team of KGF for creating such kind of blockbuster 💥⚡. It was more than a Hollywood movie. I don't get why some people are not happy with the film.

Unlike a majority of mass entertainers KGF 2 doesn't try to sneak behind a social message. Prashant Neel is clear on what he wants. A pure entertainment. If he polishes his skills he will be the next Rajamouli.Yash despite the very limited facial expressions he gives here, has the body language that fits him right into shoes of Rocky. He has given what every Star actors wish they could give to their fans but couldn't. All characters have their own memorable moments. For me Raveena Tandon and Rao Ramesh had the best scenes.Songs and Bgm are good but the sound effects were just noisy and Added with the frequent cuts the whole movie felt like an overlong trailer. Despite everything KGF 2 is entertaining and its better than KGF 1 in every aspect.

reviews.review_title: Pathetic Movie👎👎👎Worst Editing. Worst Background Music
reviews.content: What kind of movie is this. Background music is so horrible. Every dialogue director used noisy background music. You can not hear dialogue properly. After Every dialogue you feel something happen big. We have to learn something from director how to glorify and Glamourises Criminals. Hatts off to Director. Todays young generation will learn something from this movie. 70% young generation follows this slaughtered, butcher and Criminal movies.

reviews.review_title: Watchable. Only for Mass Audiences who just want fun. Could've been much better.
reviews.content:
The opening scene is energy-filled and displays fast-paced flashbacks just like Chapter 1. When Prakash Raj gears up to narrate the legend of Rocky's KGF - the most secretive part of the post-independence history of India, you can't help but admire Prashant Neel's direction. But after 5-10 minutes, you realize this is no more than a mere mass masala formula filmRocky is both shown as ruthless and merciful, depending on the requirements of the scene. That's a good idea, but like the media, critics pointed out that the Stockholm Syndrome of the miners paired with that same old mother sentiment becomes cliché and cringe. Rocky (who is treated like Übermensch in KGF) is just reduced to just delivering elevation scenes.The scenes focus on showing Mr. Rocky's swag more than his legacy of the KGF Empire. For example, some useless people enter and challenge Rocky, and he "shows his power" (the gun scene from the trailer/teaser comes here), and these are useless for the story of Kgf. It becomes a play of power, each person trying to assert his power by waging wars on each other. So, it doesn't let the story develop. They could've touched upon International Mafia-like how they had promised but didn't satisfy at all with that part. But I'll excuse this at least.The songs suck and so does the comedy. Either make an impactful song or don't keep even one. The BGM is loud, and everywhere, there's bgm! Even if someone coughs, they are ready to play some bgm!As for the production values, it is quite impressive what they've done on a relatively much lower budget as compared to other Pan-Indian films. Unless you're keen-eyed, you'll find the VFX quite realistic (especially when they show crowds of miners);
The cinematography is commendable. Watch in IMAX or on Dolby Atmos. Trust me, the experience is worth it!The only issue was that scenes (especially car chases) abruptly went dark (due to the childish style of editing)Aspects like costume design and choosing color palette have been taken care of very wellApart from the sound mixing, the camera work was annoying. During the final battle between Rocky and Adheera, the camera is shakey, and the scenes are too fast to grasp what is going on. You just wait to see who survives (and since you know who survives you just wait for the mess to get over!);Yash's acting is good; he's a self-made actor who has given his best to the KGF series. The storytelling and production values make this movie watchable.Long story short, this is not as good as Chapter 1 but certain scenes are good (revealing them would be a spoiler) and the production values & cinematography are excellent, I can't help but agree Prashant Neel has very well managed to do justice to KGF Chapter 1 and the separate fan base it had, and I hope his upcoming projects impress us 👍

The movie never tried to take itself so serious, so I wonder why people are judging it with so much discontent.It came to purely entertain and for majority of the movie, it did just that. If you expect more or less, you will most likely be disappointed.This is my first review for an Indian movie and I just had to in order to suppress any rating below 7 against this movie.ENJOY!!!

KGF: Chapter 2 has a bigger canvas, mammoth budget, huge starcasts, and scintillating music than its predecessor, but, without ROCKY BHAI, the movie will not carry any meaning. This is a one man show. Rocking Star Yash nailed his portrayal perfectly.The making of KGF franchise deserves hats off for its tantalizing making by Prashanth Neel. The way he presented Yash as Rocky Bhai was outstanding.Who doesn't hum "Sulthanaa"/"Mehbooba" after watching? Music of Ravi Basrur is now a part of my life.In a single sentence: "It's a MONSTER MOVIE."

Director Prashant Neel Has Taken this Film to another level. You will love this movie.Plus Points
*Yash
*Direction
*Supporting Star Cast
*BGM
*Complete Masala Entertainer.

Watch and learn copy paste Bollywood...
especially The Old Khan's..action+story+emotion
haters will hate..
if you think you are bad , im(Yash) your dad.. :)

Kya bolu.. jaha movie chapter 1 pe khatam hua tha wahi se iska shuruwat hota hai aur kya Kamal ka experience milta hai Hume throughout the running minutes.. superb action.. rocky bhai ka swag.. Sanjay Dutt as adhira looks total bad ass... Jitna bolu utna hi kam hai..

Clearly the director focused only on heroism and
hero elevations rather than story and emotions.Almost half of the movie scenes are designed for elevations. It would have been better if director focus is more on writing scenes and working on actors emotions.

The story of Rocky's ruling and how he overcomes all the challenges is absolutely amazing. The final plot twist was also a bit unexpected and made the show a lot better. In this movie Rocky's love for his mother and the promise he made to her which no matter what he had to do he never backed down from fulfilling the promise. There was also more romance than in the first movie and the monstrosity of Rocky is terrifying and marvelous. Hopefully, the next movie is also good like this or even better.

reviews.review_title: Rocky Build up more Build up and more build up
reviews.content:
Entire Movie is only about so much build up of Rocky character and this never ends and u get irritated waiting to see actual story.Actualy story & content is of max 30 min only
Rest 2 and half hour r for this unnecessary build up onlyThis resembles a lot with Salman khan pathetic movies where entire movie is about highlighting SalmanI feel bad for Indian Cinema that we actually do not have good content movie.

reviews.review_title: The Golden Piece We All Deserve!
reviews.content: The golden piece we all deserve!KGF Chapter 1, released in 2018 was a turning point for the entire Kannada film industry as it is relatively small compared to other major industries in India. KGF Chapter 1 made on a relatively minuscule budget had many heads turning towards the film. It became the highest-grossing movie in the history of the Kannada film industry. Since then, KGF has been a major topic for the fans of Indian cinema and even to factions of world cinema. Part one was an impressive, classy commercial Indian film with aspects of history blended with fiction and over the top action. Although I am not necessarily a fan of commercial Indian cinema, director Prashanth Neel was very clear from the beginning and stuck true to the genre throughout. This made KGF Chapter 1 stand out among many other commercial movies I knew that this was going to be something special.The release of KGF Chapter 2 was highly anticipated after that cliffhanger in part one. The teasers and trailers of Chapter 2 were literally showing the audience that they were pushing beyond the boundaries of Indian cinema to appeal to world cinema. Prashanth Neel used his technicalities to maximum effect and produced an Indian film like never before, that too from the Kannada film industry! Chapter 2 was a technical marvel and a commercial masterpiece. The film that every Indian cinema fan would have been yearning for many years. It's no doubt that KGF has breached 130 million USD global box office mark in a jiffy as this film is simply stunning to look at from every possible angle. Prashanth Neel trusted one thing, his script, and it did wonders, this is not a review as I clearly loved the film.Thank you to everyone who spared their brilliance behind the film. Special mentions has to go to Yash, the hero of in movie and the film itself and the Hombale Films for making this film a living reality for the world. A big hat off to all of you. Kolar Gold Fields is the golden piece we all deserve!

reviews.review_title: My 10 points why this movie is an average one
reviews.content: I wish to share my frank assessment of KGF 2. Sincerity be told, I am not a major fan of movies where a single hero defeats a sizable band of baddies. This is not only not conceivable, but it also inevitably leads to absurd combat scenes, defying gravity action sequences, and more. So don't count on me to praise you without question like a little kid. KGF 2 doesn't contribute anything new to the tale beyond what the first Chapter did. However, the timing and execution of the film were generally quite interesting. That doesn't mean there weren't any awkward scenes, tiresome frames, etc.The movie's shortcomings are listed below. Although this film had the potential to set a standard for subsequent action films, it fell short on a number of fronts.1. No other characters' personalities were explored in the story; it was all about Rocky.2. Rocky's goal or pledge to his mother was unquestionably supported by the public. In other words, they lacked a life of their own and relied entirely on the existence of Rocky. It might be true for a select few of his close friends, but not for 1.5 million.3. Some action sequences changed abruptly, with several dark screens in between; this was unnecessary, and it was actually painful to watch them.4. Who uses helicopters for cooling, and it doesn't look cool as well. Perhaps he might have served her with his own hands, which would have added romance and significance to the scene.5. It was excessive to hold the bridge while it was on fire and Dutt was holding it until the final car passed. The bridge was a hanging type made of wood, but everything else was cutting edge.6. Rocky was so rude towards his father because he was careless towards his mother. Is it sufficient justification to degrade his father? To justify such scene, they should have portrayed domestic abuse or anything from his father towards his mother.7. While other guys engaged in gunfights, one man consistently engaged in hand combat with hundreds of men. He had nobody to shoot at with a gun.8. What caused the girl to take care of Rocky after being abducted and transported to Dutt. Rocky pursued her, alone, of course, killing everyone in his path. He was defeated, but the events that followed didn't make sense, such as how the girl came to care about him even though he treated her quite roughly.9. Rocky didn't show any other emotion beside an angry and a macho mode, and people are calling it an acting. I'm sorry, but with just one set of emotions, you can't compare it to the standards set by performers like Kamal Hasan, Mohanlal, Amitabh, Dilip Kumar, and others who have mastered a variety of emotions. His acting is by no means masterful.10. Despite the fact that the villains carried guns and appeared in large numbers, they were occasionally depicted terrified even if Rocky was not carrying anything.I like the fast-paced narration at parts, but I will be unable to watch it again. Instead, even this time, I repeatedly skipped forward, completing the 2.5-hour film in just 1.5 hours.I could have rated it 5/10 but since kids were so much into it, they put their logic aside and overlooked all the shortcoming for entertainment. Therefore, to balance out I am rating it 1, which I totally disagree. Maybe, the viewers were treated like an entertainment by the director, actors, etc. Like how the girl was an entertainment for Rocky. Anyways, this movie is good in parts but doesn't deserve more than 8*. Yash was good if we only talk about one emotion. All the credit goes to the team for making this movie somewhat fast paced and entertaining.

reviews.review_title: Clapping, shouting and hooting filled the cinema hall.
reviews.content: Before anything i want to share about a guy sitting right beside me in the theatre. He was pissed with all the hooting in beginning of the movie saying "I can't listen anything". 1 hour into the movie i noticed him also shouting clapping and cheering. This was the Charisma of Yash (The Rocky Bhai).The entry scene of each character, BGM, acting everything surpassed all the level. A pure mass cinema and a treat to watch.

Didn't watched KGF Chapter 1 in the theatres but definitely watched Chapter 2 and I'm addicted to this story.What a movie !!!Mouth opening visuals, action scenes, background music, cinematography, direction; in short everything.What a screen presence YASH has as ROCKY. Just can't explain in words.Please don't miss the opportunity of watching this in the theatres.

After Chapter 1, Chapter 2 continues to take the KGF series to the height it deserved. Full on action and full of entertainment- a must watch. Best thing the Director-Producer has done is to release the movie in different languages taking remake out of scope for Bollywood to destroy the movie.

One of the better sequel or chapter 2 after Drishyam.Toughest part for any director is continuing a same story in second chapter. When expectations are high they need to deliver a movie with strong story lineup... KGF2 has almost succeeded and gave a perfect sequel. I watched KGF1... for the first half i got bored but story opened up after 2nd half but in KGF2 story took pace in first half but lagged in second half. Overall a good movie... a hero oriented mass movie. I like the way of narration & story connecting to the sequence. Prashant Neel has a unique way of story telling hatsoff to his direction and Yash acting is fabulous, he carries an attitude look n style throughout the movie. Cinematography is awesome BGM looks overloaded sometimes it overlaps & irritating but editing was really bad compared to KGF1 fight & chasing scenes were worstly edited. All characters in the movie were up to the mark but Sanjay Dutt was literally unwanted to this movie Adheera character could have been done by some other actors from south who is famous for villain character like Jagapathi Babu or any other actor. Sanjay Dutt couldn't connect to the story, just his looks n style were good as a villain.Go without any expectation... you will definitely like the movie.Don't miss the twist in the end & initial narration of Prakash Raj its interconnected. Thank you 😊

This movie's a treat to mass fans, which has got everything, elevations, reverberating BGM, extraordinary cinematography and novel editing.The only worry was the inconsistent screenplay, which didn't remain smooth throughout the movie, especially the love track.Yash's swag and screen presence was on another level, Sanjay Dutt looked menacing and Raveena Tandon has got a meaty role, rest were good.Not an easy task to pull off such spectacle, especially after the first part's success, but Prashanth Neel and team did it with flying colours.

Watching this in a theater is pure torture to your ears. This could be great but the overdramatized scenes by the actors make it worse. 2nd half was sloppy making the climax utterly wasted. The sheer loudness of the movie (in literal sense) gave me a headache.Wish I got my time and money back.

reviews.review_title: The best Indian movie of all time
reviews.content: Such a marvelous piece of work thus is. The story telling is awesome. Every scenes are mind blowing. Everything is so realistic. I got goosebumps every moment in theatre. The music is wonderful. The team made this film deserves a hats off. Every actors gave their 100% which took this film to next level. The pride of Indian cinema from Sandalwood. Kannada industry grown stronger....

There's immense hype for the movie. Some might get disappointed and some might be overwhelmingly happy. Personally, I loved the movie a lot.There's not much scope for the story, much like the Chapter 1. But the movie does the justice to the action sequences, buildup to the heroes, villains and other characters.Yash as Rocky bhai nailed it yet again. Other characters were superb too. Sanjay Dutt, Raveena Tandon, Sreenidhi Shetty, Achyuth Kumar, Prakash Raj and every other character were very good.However, there are two slightly underwhelming aspects. While the background music was very good, the songs weren't upto the expectations. While the hero faces a lot of challenges, it also becomes pretty obvious through the motion of the movie that the hero would be nearly unbeatable. The movie still surprises the audience with its unexpected twists.Overall, it's a very good movie. My suggestion would be not to have any expectations. It's indeed above expectations due to the scale and action.And, one shouldn't definitely miss the post-credits scene.

reviews.review_title: Capable of going toe to toe with Hollywood's MCU and Avatar.
reviews.content: Prashanth Neel's masterpiece KGF 2 brings in fresh new themes and concepts that Indian cinema rarely expresses, including the signature gothic visuals and a morally grey and emotionally broken protagonist villain. The film itself is stylized as a mythological epic taking place in the modern day and focuses on the journey of Rocky, the broken man trying to find purpose as a crime lord. It showcases both his good and bad side as he sets the slaves of Narachi free and tries to safeguard them from the neo viking Adheera and tyrannical prime minister Ramika Sen. The film is a historical landmark for Indian cinema and my 8th favorite movie.

reviews.review_title: One and only Indian super movie
reviews.content:
April 14 made a new Indian movie History by (KGF 2)🎉Performance:10/10
CGI/VFX : Stunning visuals,
Story:10/10
Cast:10/10
BGM : Excellent and Heart-thumping background scoreOverall:The performance of Yash as Rocky bhai is absolutely Killer. His style, swag, passion, dialog delivery is terrific. He has set the screen on fire with his insane screen presence. Hats off to his commitment towards KGF for 8 years. Srinidhi shetty has done her job she has got more screen time in chapter 2. Sanjay dutt was looking evil in his role and has done justice for his role, Raveena Tandon did a brilliant job. Prakash Rai, Malaika and others were good in their role.Director (Prashanth Neel Sir):Prashath Neel had done mindblowing job he will be remembered as one of the India's biggest Director in the history of Indian Cinema. Brilliant fiery Screenplay, Excellent Direction. We are used to witness elevations in between story but we feel that story is in between elevations. Pure goosebumps stuff throughout the movie. Hats off to neel for pulling up this Marvel. Cinematographer Bhvan has done amazing job each and every frame looks very Rich and has solid impact on us. Ravi Basruru has taken the Cinema to the another level his music and bgm gives goosebumps every then and now. All the other technicians did fantastic job .Negatives : Lack of blockbuster song (hardly makes a difference)An excellent successor for the first part.Direction is out of the world. Simply marvellous.🎬Editing is simply on the next level 💫Hats off to the Director -Prashanth Neel 🙌🏻Yash did an excellent work. 🥇
This movie will be marked in golden letters in Yash's cinema life and in Indian cinema history✨The entire cast and crew did a spectacular job.All the co-stars simply did their best
Sanjay Dutt and Raveena Tandon simply lived as their characters 👏It is a benchmark for mass entertainers.

Hailing from Bangalore, I always wondered why Kannada movies with a rich heritage never struck gold at the Indian box office. It was far more subdued than other South Indian film industries. KGF 1 and now KGF 2 have changed all that. It is therefore a matter of immense pride for me personally to see Kannada movies doing so well.I watched the movie at the global premiere in UAE ... the 1150pm show, even though the next day was a working day. But, not once did I regret going to a movie at such an inappropriate time. The movie was all I expected and much more. It had a great storyline that remained true to the central theme of Rocky having a motive. Every action emanates from that and which is exactly why you constantly empathize with his character, even though his villainy was obnoxious at times. That is the strength of the writing, as you viewed the character just like the way the director aspired. This for me was the biggest strength of the movie.The movie continues from where KGF1 left. All the aspirers to throne of Narachi are stunned into silence when Rocky replaces Garuda at the helm of affairs. So, to get him down, they connect with Adhira, the uncle of Garuda. The fight then is between Adhira and Rocky. You see many points where it looks like Rocky is going down to Adhira but he always has a plan up his sleeve. The culmination of that fight forms the crux of the movie.Prashant Neel has done an amazing job with his writing and direction. Every frame looks like a masterpiece and the dark muted tones makes the movie a visual delight. Some of the frames are simply out of this world. The casting is picture perfect including Adhira, Ramika and others. It seems they selected themselves for this role. I would recommend this movie to every cinema lover.The climax is a killer and after the Kattappa Bahubali saga, this is indeed a break point to cherish. I hope the makers of KGF have a plan up their sleeve.

Outstanding movie.....this movie will surely break all the records, fantastic direction and action , storyline is more then perfect. Acting by the actors are top notch. A must movie for every single person. (100/100)

reviews.review_title: Go to the theatres. Otherwise you might regret missing this one on big screens!
reviews.content: Prashanth Neel is the man who deserves the most appreciation. Direction, screenplay, dialogues...almost everything from his part was fabulous.The whole credit goes to the technical crew for bringing out such a beautiful script in a fast paced screenplay without a glitch or any sense of out of flow of the story. The screenplay was tight for the 2.50 hrs film. Editing was tight and amazing. No lags. Cinematography was brilliant.Music... is the master. It elevates you up and gives goosebumps every time.Yash is really the Rocking star. His looks and style are awesome. Action sequences are taken to the next level.Sanjay Dutt, Raveena Tandon and Srinidhi Shetty were engaging in their own roles. Other cast also did their parts well.This movie is to be enjoyed in theatres. Don't miss the chance! Brilliantly made.

After the assassination of garuda, Andrews,desai, guru pandian and kamal are shocked to see that rocky has also killed its successor virat and taken the rule of KGF. Rocky rehabilitates the slaves and creates his own army. He also kidnaps reena and makes her stay with him. Meanwhile, adheera returns to reclaim kgf and also ramika sen becomes the prime minister and swears to destroy kgf. How rocky deals with these new enemies and what happens to him in the end forms kgf chapter 2.What I loved in kgf chapter 1 was rocky bhai's "if you are bad, I am your dad" attitude which was in full swing during its first half. Wheras in the second half that was missing and also rocky didn't have much dialogues in it. But in chapter 2 his that attitude is at its peak. The attitude along with some elevation scenes gave me a blast at the theatre. My favorite scene is the Kalashnikov one. Paisa vasool scene. Ravi basrur's music and bgm is the backbone of the film. Sulthana song picturization was a feast at theatre.Coming to performances, YASH, YASH, YASH! You were rocking. The whole movie, he was wearing only suit and he looked so dashing in it. What a charisma! What a screen presence! Truly a star material. Since his release from jail in 2016, none of the films done by sanjay dutt could mark his comeback. But after watching kgf chapter 2, we can finally say that baba is back. He was very good.Raveena tandon also got a very powerful role as ramika sen. Srinidhi shetty was fine. Prakash raj replaces anant nag as the narrator and did his job well. Another character I loved was vanaram who was a cruel villain in chapter 1 but transforms here as the kattappa of kgf.What didn't work for me in the film was rocky vs adheera fight. I know that it was shot when sanjay dutt was sick and he bravely returned to do them on his own but the makers decided to make the choreography as safe as possible considering dutt's health instead of being a brutal one. Also adheera shoots rocky but not killing him was a biggest mistake from a character point. Also the last act follows the traditional route of a gangster film by showing the downfall of the hero. Here its where the film dips where even the flashback of the mother scene(like chapter 1 climax) doesn't give an impact. But the mid credit scene once again lifts the film's spirit.On the whole, kgf chapter 2 is bigger and better than chapter 1 where we get one of the best antihero of Indian cinema rocky bhai and hats off to prasanth neel's ambitious vision which will take Indian cinema to the next level.

reviews.review_title: A Tragedy Coated in Masala Elements
reviews.content: Right from the outset (the intro) you know what you're into. You're not watching KGF 2 to see some artistic masterpiece, you're watching it for a commercial mass-terpiece. And it fulfils its role extremely well, with dizzying action sequences made only better by the frantic camera movement, and dialogues that have just as much power as Rocky's hammer.Aside from the mass, the plot itself is quite tragic. We see a man who only knows how to hold the accelerator, and who refuses to press the brake pedal. His demise is inevitable. The ending of his story very much depicts this tragedy, albeit incredibly stylishly shot.The music is hauntingly iconic as usual. One thing I didn't particularly like was the set piece before the interval, where the screen kept on suddenly turning black. It puts a strain on the eyes to watch. This blockbuster tale was made on a budget of a mere £10 million (a small amount compared to the average hollywood film). Watch it for what it is (a masala movie) not for artistic quality.

NOT JUST SCREEN BUT THEATER EXPLODE ENTERTAINER WITH SEAT SHAKING BGM SCORE BY Ravi Basrur ...Its AN EPIC BLOCKBUSTER...
EKDUM ANGAAR / ZEHER MAAFIK "PAISA VASOOL"...This Yash aka ROCKY aka "THE HATHODA BEAST" show have all ingredients of entertainment required for any masala movie. HATHODA - A signature weapon of him now on.Be it music/ BGM, Action scenes, dialogues, cinematography, writing/editing or any other..a True Winner. Great epic writing and direction by Prashanth NeelSanjay Dutt as ADHEERA is Mega Outstanding performer.All Oher actors have done commendable work in the flick.Do not miss POST CREDIT scene#KGFVerse - SAB KO FODEGA AUR HATHODE SE TODEGA BOX OFFICE RECORDS...INFINITY RAISED TO POWER OF INFINITY RATED FLICK.....MUST EXPERIENCE MONSTER ERA.....

I wish I could give stars more than 10. Yash as always rocking as Rocky and Sanjay Dutt played his role to the fullest as Adheera. The movie is a must watch for all the kgf fans, you will not get disappointed.

Disappointed to compare with first part. Because of expected the Rocky's Mom character more, but it's very low
Then bgm is not bad, but i expected the kgf chapter 1 bgm like.Then yash Role is good that only positive of this film.
Worst movie of 2022 watch this movie at your risk and don't use brain only overacting over emotion.hero is God no need to story only swag. I don't watch this type of movie.

KGF2 - One should accept that if there could be a movie which can have a mass opening in par with a Bahubali, a RRR and many other it can only be KGF2. Flabbergasted by the kind of reception this movie had from the very beginning title card . It was indeed Larger than life. It took me 3.5 years to watch KGF 1 and that was a huge miss but this time I ensured not to make the same mistake and I did KGF2 in about 48hrs of release and I feel superbly happy . I repeat , the directors vision, control on the story and the screenplay, everything was at its best . Ravi Basrur, never heard before KGF and can never forget post either, brilliant music may it be songs or BGM. His contribution brought in so much life to the movie . Bhuvan Gowdaf for excellent cinematography, it was a different and amazing world altogether. And there was this whole load of actors including Sanjay Dutt, Raveena , Prakashraj, Srinidhi , Easwari Rao weaving this wonderful movie with a solid needle called Yash . Undoubtedly he pulls out his life's finest performance here and without missing even a inch he perfectly fits to the character . He's Super Smart and Sema Fit . I bet , none but him could have done this role any better . Salam Rocky Bhai. This is not just a movie but an experience. Loved every bit of it . Huge respect to director Prashanth Neel , words can't just say the kind of work he has put in . Class apart . I would say, The real BEAST of this season is ROCKY. Overall KGF, King of Great Films.Note : Dont miss the scenes post credits at end of movie.

KGF 2 - one of the best theatrical experience I ever had,The major positive is narration director just nailed it,The visuals, music and Yash with his screen presence,Kudos to all technicians...Worth all the hype.

Very badly written movie. A movie made for the chapri and liked by the chapri . If you are making a film about gangster or criminal then show him like that , why showing him like a God and people praising him like God is far from logic.Cinematography was good rest everything was bad and headache to watch.

reviews.review_title: 10 star for KGF Maa Theme Music
reviews.content: 10 star for KGF Maa Theme Music. I hoped they would a full song out of that. It is so peaceful and heart touching. Best sequel ever made. Story so well carved. Sanjay Dutt's screen presence is less. He should have got more screen presence to create a strong competition.

I usually don't trust 2 chapters of any film. I got disappointed by many movies.But this time it's not the case.Rocky rocked it.Pros.1. Perfect placement of characters
2. Best story line
3. Action packed
5. Dominating entry scenes
6. Dialogs at it's best
5. Aesthetics
6. Good cgi effects (except insyath kalil's)
7. Makes you to seat at edge of your seat.8. Scenes are not clicheCons.1. Damn why, why did they not used the bgm of previous movie as it is. Tweaked bgm sucks.2. Movie rolls fast. But it does not go out of line.3. Non of the songs are remarkable
4. They should have given emphasis to adheera to this chapter and taken others in chapter 3.5. Romance feels dry. Poor heroine became spectator in most parts.
Great action don movie. Some big directors must learn how to direct an action movie with low budget. This movie made with 100C but it looks like the movie is made with a budget more than 500C.

Plot acha dia har bar dono movie mai.. Phele vale mai execute krdia.. Second vale mai kya hi chal rha tha inko hi pata hai...direction was bad.. Sanjay dutt and rocky fighting was bad.. Just shaking camera.. Should have worked on it.. Villan should have more screen time... Everything was top notch but they failed to execute it..

As expected power pack performance by Yash Sir and Sanjay sir and whole team.Extraordinary climatic visualisation and the directing is really Appriciated by all the movie lover specially KGF or Rocky bhaii fan😃.No word for commenting and Best of luck for great success👍.

Chapter one is having at least some story but part 2 has No story line. Movie is only fictional and over dramatic. Side actor are super over actor. Part 2 is base less, hero don't know why he is earning money. Animation is not up to the mark very basic type of animation is being used.

reviews.review_title: 9.8! Fab! Awesome! Amazing! Mind-blowing! And more whichever is possible!
reviews.content: I just got out of the hall and I'm total speechless. I'm just amazed by the direction and story and dialogues of this movie! Earlier i was a huge fan of KGF chapter 1 but now that movie is just another prequel to me that led to a killing sequel! Hats off to the directors, actors, and music composers. A dedicated shout-out to the story writing team 🔥You rock guys! Salaam Rocky Bhai!

Welcome to the cinema of the man-child! Watching the film is like watching a cinema version of the games kids play with their action figures, the sounds they make to mimic explosions, figures flying in the air in slow motion, if you get what I mean! But what is actually interesting is the attempt to stitch various genres and styles together. Michael Bay meets Prakash Mehra? Yes! Nouvelle vague jump cuts meet classic Indian melodrama? Yes! Mad Max meets Scarface? Yes! The story is predictable and formulaic, it is really Robin Hood with a Kalashnikov. The dialogues are almost witty but not really so. It meanders in a confused manner through its own plot. Even then the film has its undeniable moments of glory. A spark of brilliance is there somewhere in this film, but hidden beneath layers and layers of VFX! Despite everything certain images, sounds and scenes get strongly etched in one's mind, one does end up rooting for the protagonist's journey. I watched it once and enjoyed it while it lasted. Not going to watch it again though.

reviews.review_title: He is the BIGGEST criminal, he is the BIGGEST business man, this is the BIGGEST national issue!
reviews.content: K. G. F: Chapter 2 was directed by Prashanth Neel and stars once again Yash as Rocky Bhai, the new kingpin of Kolar Gold Fields (also known as K. G. F.). Srinidhi Shetty, Archana Jois, Malavika Avinash, Ayyappa P. Sharma, Harish Rai and Dinesh Mangaluru reprise their roles from the first chapter, while Sanjay Dutt, Raveena Tandon, Saran Sakthi, Eswari Rao and Prakash Raj are the new cast members in this sequel. Chapter 2 is definitely a step-up, compared to the last installment. It's bigger and better, and the production value and action sequences have vastly improved. K. G. F: Chapter 2 is, without a doubt, a commercial film, but the difference between this movie and other Indian commercial films is that the movie relies heavily on the script. The film is 2 hours and 48 minutes long, and it doesn't waste any single frame during the entire runtime. There isn't one unnecessary scene that feels it doesn't belong in the script. Kudos to the producer, Vijay Kiragandur for understanding and sharing Prashanth Neal's vision, for appreciating this bold script and for letting Neel execute the film exactly how he wanted.Bhuvan Gowda's cinematography is probably the best one I've seen in the past few years, when it comes to Indian cinema. It's evident that the crew has invested a lot in production values and set designs by just looking at the cinematography and see how detailed every frame is implemented. Every single frame is jaw-dropping and astoundingly gorgeous, and the visual effects are undoubtedly on point. Ujwal Kulkarni also deserves to be praised for editing the film as smoothly as possible and for keeping the movie thrilling and engaging from start to end. The amazing score and soundtrack by Ravi Basrur elevates the movie to a whole another level. It captures the emotions the characters go through, creates tension and increases the excitement level beautifully. The action sequences handled by Anbariv are astonishing and beyond what you could've ever imagined. It's also worth to mention that the action sequences rely heavily on practical effects, and the fact that they are in the same range as Hollywood films, such as Fast & Furious, Die Hard and Mad Max: Fury Road is refreshing to watch.All the cast members have delivered powerhouse performances. Yash proves once again that he is the man of the show. His dialogue delivery and the way he perform the fight choreography are magnificent. Like I mentioned in my previous reviews, it's very important that the antagonist is equally as strong as the protagonist both mentally and physically to keep the film engaging. The way Prashanth Neel has structured and developed the character Adheera is excellent. Sanjay Dutt was absolutely the perfect choice for this role, and he knocked it out of the park with style. Raveena Tandon, Eswari Rao and Prakash Raj were also brilliant in their respective roles as Prime Minister Ramika Sen, Farman's mother and Vijayendra Ingalagi. Archana Jois, who portrayed Rocky's mother, Shanthamma, may have very little screen time compared to the rest of the cast, but she has surely delivered a phenomenal performance. Srinidhi Shetty, who portrayed Rocky's love interest, Reena Desai, definitely has a lot more to do in this film, compared to Chapter 1, and she has also delivered a neat performance.Overall, K. G. F: Chapter 2 can easily be considered as one of the best action films India has ever produced, mainly for its technical finesse, strong dialogues, exceptional cinematography and brilliant performances. Don't miss it in the theaters.

Story:
Story continues from KGF chapter 1 right where it ended. The plot is very clean and perfectly executed. But, a small part is misconnecting chapter 1 and 2. (Not mentioned due to spoiler)
Music:
There is nothing new about the music. As usual, it is extraordinary. Best viewed in Dolby atmos.Screenplay& Direction:

reviews.review_title: One of the matured stories in a sequel ever?!!
reviews.content:
Plus:
Showing actual (negative roles) of Andrews,Rajendra desai and Kamal was really a good story for beginning of KGF2.Vanaram's continuation looked good too. He doesnt show any aggression even in chapter1 and is wise character was really good and perfectly suited .Confusion cleared how Adheera is alive and it was as interesting as possible.Dubai scene of Inayath and Rocky was intelligent from director . And also getting new weapons from him too . Perfectly synced scene these all are without any deviation in story. Dialogue scene when Rocky kills adheera henchmen and revealing of the weapons was really brilliant like a revenge.Director displayed a creative side of Rocky too. The way he changed KGF infrastructure was shown at a perfect timing.Screenplay and bgm syncing was unique and exciting during car chase scene when Reena was captured.Twists of the movie are really unique. Happy to see modern age movies getting modern twists. Also corrupt politicians scene in front of PM was good beginning of rivalry.A Unique location for a climax too. Also concluded kgf birth is rocky's birth . As well as kgf's end is rocky's end.Every suspense characters from chapter 1 was logically continued in chapter 2.Minus:
Few scenes looked like old movie scenes like herione getting captured, Hero spending his life not as a citizen of country because a promise, Because of a promise of a kid ,U cannot live selfishly.Rocky and Adheera's fight too looked bit routine. Chapter 1's last fight was masterpiece actually. Looked like adheera's character ended bit hurry without any planning attacks.'INSPIRATION of Rocky' scenes deserve more hype than people 'SCARED of Adheera'. Few one man army Adheera scenes could have been better but director cared on duration so fine. Only one piece of location were Rocky's army and Adheera's fight so even that looked bit dissappointing as he could cover other locations of Modern KGF infrastructure.

Am eager to see what sukumar sir has stored in for us in pushpa part 2. Also my excitement for prabhas garu's next film salar with prashanth neel has gotten to the sky. And am sure there would be no risk in expecting a masterpiece from the duo of prabhas and prashanth neel.

I love each and every sheen's and dialogs of this movie . Rocky bhai acting is amazing. Acting of Adhira as a villain character is next level.All actor and actress have worked very hard. Director's visualization power for this movie is wonderful. He executed each and every things of this movie perfectly whether it is storytelling, sounds, visual effects all are at next level.
KGF chapter 2 is a genuine mass entertaining film. Prashanth Neel's direction and Yash's outstanding performance made a great film ever. I think this film gona be historical blockbuster.

KGF: Chapter 2, amazingly enough, is a sequel to KGF, which stands for the name of a gold field in India. The film has regional relevance for Indian moviegoers, but not so much for those outside of India. The Gold Field plot has been done several times in other films (and much better), so the original and this sequel still have a lot to go to reach those levels of entertainment for international audiences. Character development and motivation are important things that should not be left out of a good film. This film (and the first one as well) suffers from those deficiencies. One of the good things about the film, at least, is that there is no song and dance number.
Worst movie of the year. Waste of time. Too long. You will get a headache by watching this. Please save yourself.......................................

This is a perfect example of how to make a movie successful by creating media hype. Means even God Ram is not praised this way in Ramayana. Means every single frame is about Sir Rocky. Seriously.And in Chapter 2, Rocky Sir seated in style in front of Prime Minister of India and entered in Parliament with a gun.Really disgusted by seeing such a movie becoming a hit across India. The build up behind those scenes are amazing. Brilliant cinematography. Kudos to the cinematographer 👏👏👏👏. Let me now talk about the performances of every actor. OMG!! Yash, Yash and Yash amazing performance. Apart from that, Sanjay Dutt stands out as a menacing villain in a gruesome avtaar and ofcourse, the comeback of Raveena Tandon in a short but powerful act. Brutal action, top notch performances, Stunning visuals, Heart-thumping background score and the climax makes this a must watch.Completely mind blowing movie a total power packed package. And the climax makes this a must watch.Long story short KGF 2 is a must must action thriller !! Don't miss it!!

Watch this movie for entertainment, don't judge the plot and don't try to be Sherlock Holmes, just be a random person who wants entertainment, and you will be entertained.

reviews.review_title: Excellent movie and the sandalwood movie made
reviews.content: The movie is truly well made. Every scene is shot with perfection. The visuals are amazing and no cost has been spared in making this movie. However, the lead actress has a tough time showing expression on her face which is disappointing.

reviews.review_title: You will be left dissapointed if you loved KFG Chapter 1
reviews.content: I'm really dissapointed. I'm actually upset that I've decided to write this review.KGF 1 was amazing. I fell in love with the Yash, he was cool, caring and a legend and he had a clear goal and achieved it by saving everyone.KGF 2 he didn't have any of that. A great suit game. However, he wasn't cool, caring or a badass. He came off as an asshole and you never quite knew what his motives were. The romance came out of nowhere. This movie left me unhappy, dissapointed and a little sad. What a terrible ending. Story dragged felt like I've wasted my time. Story really sucked. It was hard to follow and made no sense most of the time. It really did not deliver and I don't understand how people rate this movie so high.It just didn't have the emotional stakes and yash was so unlikeable in this movie. He was not the hero/villian I fell in love with.What a terrible ending as well. I don't feel satisfied and wish I had never watched part 2.Part 1 I rated 9/10 and I was happy how it ended and will be rewatching it again.Part 2 I never want to think about it again.
The most awaited movie, I saw this movie in theatre, I was stunned.it was worth.i can't stop myself to see this movie on Repeatation.yash, sanjay sir , raveen just nailed it.

reviews.review_title: Greatest bet to Hollywood from Indian Cinema till date. Best cinematic experiences ever, best action suspense thriller from #KannadaCinema #SandalwoodIndustry #IndianCinema
reviews.content:
Just as I hoped that my 2nd viewing backed by a proper sound system(& less fussy audience), could possibly make me love the world of #KGF more than my 1st distorted viewing, it actually did a bigger turnaround for me. With proper scope to hear the dialogues clearly, and by getting the BGM's effect as intended, just as Rocky says, it inflicted "Collateral damage" this time around! 😎😍👊Damn!! How could #PrashanthNeel do this time and again!!!🔥 You're a monster my Man, you are the one! An asset to #KannadaCinema & #IndianCinema. Take a bow before anything is told.As I always tend to lay emphasis on a directors' work to be largely responsible for an appealing movie, & deservedly so, I am left STUNNED, for the 2nd time running, in as many chapters of KGF! Because an equal or even bigger asset is none other than our #RockingStar #Annthamma YASH.😍😍😍😍🔥
Despite trying to play down the contribution of an actor to the overall quality of any film, I took Yash too for granted, knowing a star actor always gives a great performance at max & nothing more than that. But this guy makes me go bonkers again over an actor's performance matching/ ascending the brilliance of a director!! What aura #Yash carries around him, his work, or his personal life! That blitzkrieg of a performance, with all of that swagger, attitude, unmatchable charm, impeccable mannerisms, flawless dialogue sense, and thereby carving a niche' at acting which has been his childhood dream! He dreamt of being a superstar, but HE NOW IS ENROUTE TO BE THE BIGGEST SUPERSTAR OF INDIA! Make no mistake.. There might be many capable, I doubt if there are many AS DETERMINED. The guy has not acted like Rocky, it's just Rocky being Rocky in front of camera too.Elated as I re-write my #KGFReview, I want to address the so called over the top stuff first, because now, I get the most of it, and if not I would not have loved the movie as much!Nitpicked issues from FDFS viewing:
1. Reena's initial behaviour in the entry sequence, and Rocky attaching a cringe label to her. This started the beginning of the spoil sport for me earlier, which made me switch off my thinking hat and look down on all further such possible loose pointers. It still is an issue to digest, unless, we look at it as a deliberate move by Rocky to begin the onslaught, starting with the guy who gets triggered by this!!2. Vanaram hunting sequence (the good will). It's actually an insane & cool way to win over, by committing himself, by going ALL IN, because that guy was CRUCIAL! Now, visualize what Rocky did again, is it that cringy!!?🔥🔥
3. Adheera's "cringe entry swag, the bridge". Hold it there, may not be too convincing but hey, did you now probably get why he's out there with the Ragnar Lothbrok attire? Isn't that why Adheera's guy smirks at "the situation" and makes way for Adheera to get in? 😎👊
4. "The chase" is something that even the director could back up with any reasoning. Poor let down.5. The "Offer closes soon" cringe. If you watched what Rocky planned before making the business offer, and what transpired onto the guy who's at the receiving end who was unwilling to join hands, that's a genius Rocky moment right there. Damn, the vacation he planned!! That writing and execution! 🔥😍😎 (top it with the Kalashnikov put to use right after the Interval, the vacation was a real masterstroke). What I thought was cringe, is a work of geniusness! 👊
6. Adheera giving up the opportunity is backed by himself, not too credible, but yeah kinda makes half sense. And Rocky doing the reverse favour was actually not digestible. But hey, he is ROCKY, he wants to return the favour exactly, no? 😎😍 Kinda digestible.7. Cut to climax, the cringe with Reena's situation and the impending danger, Rocky is actually fully focused on the TASK he is set to achieve, and he knows that if they made in roads from that direction, it's coming to an end.. So he doesn't react emotionally, but sets out to tell the people to evacuate and ask them to be "Ready". Moreover, in his mind when he knows hiw it will end, he doesn't want to do much about the situation than to exercise his ultimate PLAN!8. THE ULTIMATE PLAN: Remember the dialogues the mother and the son exchange in the trailer while she puts him asleep? We only comfortably focus on what Rocky says to his mom there, right!?? 😹😹😹
9. That Crazy sounding end credits song and BGM!! *EVERYONE IS A GANGSTER, UNTIL YOU SEE THE MONSTER*😍🔥🔥🔥Cant wait to have the song in my playlist and ringtone!!In my first viewing I couldn't hear it well, and that mix up of all languages, kinda added to my frustration then. But boy, when I heard it the 2nd time, whatta song and what a BGM that follows (same BGM used during ROCKY's ultimate Air handling of Kalashnikov near Varka)!! SHOUT IT OUT.. THIS, IS, KGF....🔥
9. I take my word back on both Ravi Basrur and Neel. One soothing song is good, but a bit off the track of the movie and has Hindi, so had put me off earlier. But RANA RANA RANADHEERA gets better like fine wine, and gives you a raging high , and Banda banda aaya aaya (everybody's a gangster theme) leaves you on the verge of insanity to end the show off.10. Chapter 3 hint Post credits!Pheww! This mad man Prashanth Neel's response to all the euphoria about Hollywood n stuff. Missed this the 1st time, as the song had put me off., ironically..
Why am I saying Hollywood!? Well observe it yourselves, that accent, that teaser he gave by adding that "Hollywood entity".. Man, I wanted KGF 2 to end all this while when crazy fans wanted chapter 3. After watching this teaser, bring the heck on you MONSTER! Cant wait for the Hollywood level flick you have accepted to make 😍🔥
11. Dialogues! Denser dialogues in Chapter 2, even Guru Pandian's dialogue in the beginning about the King cobra.. And those Rocky's dialogues with both tinges of Swag and comic sense. Especially in the entry sequence, and the Parliament house.🔥🔥🔥🔥😍1st viewing response: Chapter 2 is just 70% of Chapter 1.2nd viewing response: Chapter 2 is on A BIGGER LEVEL, MONSTER MODE ..

Vanaram hunting sequence (the good will). It's actually an insane & cool way to win over, by committing himself, by going ALL IN, because that guy was CRUCIAL! Now, visualize what Rocky did again, is it that cringy!!?🔥🔥
3. Adheera's "cringe entry swag, the bridge". Hold it there, may not be too convincing but hey, did you now probably get why he's out there with the Ragnar Lothbrok attire? Isn't that why Adheera's guy smirks at "the situation" and makes way for Adheera to get in? 😎👊
4. "The chase" is something that even the director could back up with any reasoning. Poor let down.5. The "Offer closes soon" cringe. If you watch Rocky planned before making the businesJust as I hoped that my 2nd viewing backed by a proper sound system(& less fussy audience), could possibly make me love the world of #KGF more than my 1st distorted viewing, it actually did a bigger turnaround for me. With proper scope to hear the dialogues clearly, and by getting the BGM's effect as intended, just as Rocky says, it inflicted "Collateral damage" this time around! 😎😍👊Damn!! How could #PrashanthNeel do this time and again!!!🔥 You're a monster my Man, you are the one! An asset to #KannadaCinema & #IndianCinema. Take a bow before anything is told.As I always tend to lay emphasis on a directors' work to be largely responsible for an appealing movie, & deservedly so, I am left STUNNED, for the 2nd time running, in as many chapters of KGF! Because an equal or even bigger asset is none other than our #RockingStar #Annthamma YASH.😍😍😍😍🔥
Despite trying to play down the contribution of an actor to the overall quality of any film, I took Yash too for granted, knowing a star actor always gives a great performance at max & nothing more than that. But this guy makes me go bonkers again over an actor's performance matching/ ascending the brilliance of a director!! What aura #Yash carries around him, his work, or his personal life! That blitzkrieg of a performance, with all of that swagger, attitude, unmatchable charm, impeccable mannerisms, flawless dialogue sense, and thereby carving a niche' at acting which has been his childhood dream! He dreamt of being a superstar, but HE NOW IS ENROUTE TO BE THE BIGGEST SUPERSTAR OF INDIA! Make no mistake.. There might be many capable, I doubt if there are many AS DETERMINED. The guy has not acted like Rocky, it's just Rocky being Rocky in front of camera too.Elated as I re-write my #KGFReview, I want to address the so called over the top stuff first, because now, I get the most of it, and if not I would not have loved the movie as much!Nitpicked issues from FDFS viewing:
1. Reena's initial behaviour in the entry sequence, and Rocky attaching a cringe label to her. This started the beginning of the spoil sport for me earlier, which made me switch off my thinking hat and look down on all further such possible loose pointers. It still is an issue to digest, unless, we look at it as a deliberate move by Rocky to begin the onslaught, starting with the guy who gets triggered by this!!2. Vanaram hunting sequence (the good will). It's actually an insane & cool way to win over, by committing himself, by going ALL IN, because that guy was CRUCIAL! Now, visualize what Rocky did again, is it that cringy!!?🔥🔥
3. Adheera's "cringe entry swag, the bridge". Hold it there, may not be too convincing but hey, did you now probably get why he's out there with the Ragnar Lothbrok attire? Isn't that why Adheera's guy smirks at "the situation" and makes way for Adheera to get in? 😎👊
4. "The chase" is something that even the director could back up with any reasoning. Poor let down.5. The "Offer closes soon" cringe! If you watched what Rocky planned before making the business offer, and what that could transpire onto the guy who's at the receiving end who was unwilling to join hands, that's a genius Rocky moment right there. Damn, the vacation he planned!! That writing and execution! 🔥😍😎 (top it with the Kalashnikov put to use right after the Interval, the vacation was a real masterstroke). What I thought was cringe, is a work of geniusness! 👊
6. Adheera giving up the opportunity is backed by himself, not too credible, but yeah kinda makes half sense. And Rocky doing the reverse favour was actually not digestible. But hey, he is ROCKY, he wants to return the favour exactly, no? 😎😍 Kinda digestible.7. Cut to climax, the cringe with Reena's situation and the impending danger, Rocky is actually fully focused on the TASK he is set to achieve, and he knows that if they made in roads from that direction, it's coming to an end.. So he doesn't react emotionally, but sets out to tell the people to evacuate and ask them to be "Ready". Moreover, in his mind when he knows hiw it will end, he doesn't want to do much about the situation than to exercise his ultimate PLAN!8. THE ULTIMATE PLAN: Remember the dialogues the mother and the son exchange in the trailer while she puts him asleep? We only comfortably focus on what Rocky says to his mom there, right!?? 😹😹😹
9. That Crazy sounding end credits song and BGM!! *EVERYONE IS A GANGSTER, UNTIL YOU SEE THE MONSTER*😍🔥🔥🔥Cant wait to have the song in my playlist and ringtone!!In my first viewing I couldn't hear it well, and that mix up of all languages, kinda added to my frustration then. But boy, when I heard it the 2nd time, whatta song and what a BGM that follows (same BGM used during ROCKY's ultimate Air handling of Kalashnikov near Varka)!! SHOUT IT OUT.. THIS, IS, KGF....🔥
9. I take my word back on both Ravi Basrur and Neel. One soothing song is good, but a bit off the track of the movie and has Hindi, so had put me off earlier. But RANA RANA gets better like fine wine , and Banda banda (everybody's a gangster theme) is of next level. 🔥
10. Chapter 3 hint Post credits!Pheww! This mad man Prashanth Neel's response has to all the euphoria about Hollywood n stuff. Why am I saying Hollywood!? Well observe it yourselves, that accent, that teaser he gave by adding that "Hollywood entity".. Man, I wanted KGF 2 to end all this while when crazy fans wanted chapter 3. After watching this teaser, bring the heck on you MONSTER! Cant wait for the Hollywood level flick you have accepted to make 😍🔥
11. Dialogues! Denser dialogues in Chapter 2, even Guru Pandian's dialogue in the beginning about the King cobra.. And those Rocky's dialogues with both tinges of Swag and comic sense. Especially in the entry sequence, and the Parliament house.🔥🔥🔥🔥😍1st viewing response: Chapter 2 is just 70% of Chapter 1.2nd viewing response: Chapter 2 is on A BIGGER LEVEL, MONSTER MODE ..

reviews.review_title: Truckloads of BS served as a movie
reviews.content: Hundreds of Villain with guns surrender to barehand Yash without trying. Most wanted criminal goes to PMO but is not nabbed. Navy sinks a Ship full of the world's largest trench of Gold because barehanded Yash was standing in it. Yash uses mother of all rifles with 1000+ rounds of bullets to terrorise CBI but uses punches, hammers and machate's when action fighting. The list is endless.Damn.. so much cringe even a recall makes me cringe again..Common sense goes north the movie goes south.. Anybody who has even some IQ can't rate this movie above 1.BG score reminds you of two trucks banging into each other.. one has tin cans and other has pigs. Absolutely loud and out of place.Editor probably used a kaleidoscope to edit the movie. Every second the frame changes and two unrelated stories are run in parallel in almost half of the movie. Those with vertigo or motion sickness should avoid. Others should also avoid.One of the worst movies I've wasted my time and money on. Sheer BS.

Art is for the Humans, by the Humans Period!Not watching this mighty film on big screen is equivalent to seeing Monalisa in real life. She's only an art if she's on canvas. If not, she just a normal looking human being like everyone.Similarly this brutally crude, appealingly exhilarating, superabundant entertainer can only be savored on Big Screen.Cinema is where the 24 commanding art forms come together into an invincibly aggregated energy and we as Humans are bound to behold the beauty: The KGF Chapter 2.We can't teach a monkey to ponder & dissect the facets of a multilayered piece of art even if we dedicate our whole lives in training it. Of all things bestowed on the so-called "supremely heavenly entities" Human Beings, the ability to cognize, analyze & comprehend an art form is the apex of all. Imbibing art, appreciating the art form glorifies the Human existence and maintains the balance between sanity & insanity of Life.KGF Chapter 2 is barely an integral chapter in the history of Indian Cinema. It's a frickin' textbook on commercial condiments of art-imbuing Cinema. It's something bigger than you, me, and us and above us.It's the redemption of endangering big screen phenomenon called CINEMA. This is CINEMA. It's inspiring, loud, taut, larger-than-life, rooted, astonishing, wild, inspiring & joyous.I am completely steeped in the notion that the maker Prashant Neel who throttled this carnival is an alien and until he himself persuades me into believing he's not I am going to firmly stick to that assertion.If you are a human and resist watching films like this you are not worth being a HUMAN. I'm sorry! But this is how it is. Cinema is not just an entertainer. CINEMA is art. Cinema is giving Life. Cinema is eternal, Cinema is responsibility, and Cinema is an experience with no replacement.Cinema is larger than life. Beyond! Period. If you say otherwise fight & win me (that's impossible)
This is not a review. It's a thank you note to the Cinema makers, of the cinema KGF, & by the Cinema admirer.Bala (ScreenWriter)

KGF2 GARGANTUAN BLOCKBUSTERSBacked by solid emotions KGF Chapter2 goes all guns blazing with SPLENDID elevation scenes - world class visuals - wicked action scenes & act of a lifetime by Yash.Prashanth Neel excels himself- Made one of the best sequel ever.Yash emerges BIGGEST PAN INDIA SUPERSTAR WITH KGF Chapter2 .. Salaam Rocky Bhai .

reviews.review_title: A VISUAL GRANDEUR & BENCH MARK FOR INDIAN CINEMA...!
reviews.content: Prashanth Neel now joins the elite club of great iconic directors of Indian cinema be it tna making,value of script,narration or writing,deserves an applause....gives out a clear msg to bollywood makers to forget their propaganda or nepotism...Ravi basrur bgm and sound mixing is Oscar worthy and forms core of the film...UJWAL KULKARNI is now the youngest editor of Indian cinema and his works are out of the box and does glorify the film to new level...the emotional contents in the 2nd half shows the director is not intended to give just a commercial hit but shows is ability in mastering the art of direction...the sleek cuts in action sequences takes a next level of editing and especially the car chase sequence and it's bgm will rip u apart if u watch it in a good Audi theatre...overall KGF 2 is a visual extravaganza and pride of South Indian films...what could have been better is screenplay with indepth detailing instead of spending more on sets.

reviews.review_title: A larger-than-life, highly enjoyable rags to riches, urchin to overlord movie.

The movie seems like a modern-day myth, or a lost city of El Dorado and its untold riches. Brilliant and definitely worth sitting through the epic 5-hour story.

There is violence so the kids under 10 years should not watch it. No abusive words and intimate scenes.

reviews.review_title: KGF is not a film. It's a HISTORY!!!
reviews.content: Congratulations & Hatts Off to the Writer-Director PRASHANT NEEL for making this masterpiece and creating his perfect vision and bringing to the audience. Before KGF I've could've never imagine that Kannada Cinema could create such masterpiece but it's all Over Now. From Now On this is the INDIAN CINEMA. Execution & the way director has present the KGF story is just brilliant. It's 2 hrs 48 mins long movie but the screenplay is so fast paced that no one can imagine how this time has passed. Performance of all the actors and supporting cast has just nailed it. The problem with this franchise is the "build up". They build up on everything they can get. Every person they introduce needs a build up with grand music and wow shots.The story, there are loopholes. There are mistakes here and there but nobody seems to bat an eye. The CGI works is quite poor for a lot of the parts. The editing is just so so.Also, Adheera's role is such a waste. Such a villainous build up since Chapter 1 that ends up being useless. He isn't terrifying neither does he do something really impactful. Sanju bhaiya just looks uninterested in most of his scenes. Perhaps could have gotten a more terrifying looking actor instead of just roping a big name from Bollywood?However, the music score is spot on and all the actors pull off their characters undeniably well. Hats off for that.In the end, everyone is just mad crazy of the grandiose of this movie that they are giving it 10/10. Nobody wants to sit and talk about the breakdown of it.

Only saving grace is Sanjay Dutt.
