reviews.review_title: Movie is total disaster....save ur mind and body from this
reviews.content: I come with great expectations for the movie after its chapter 1 success. As I entered the theatre movie starts with boom and ends with boom. Too much overdramatic that I tried to bear but it's over load BGM made me think to run away from theatre. Every scene starts with very loud BGM that I want to ask the director why??? Have some mercy on viewers. But I even more shocking that people are appreciating the movie by giving shoutouts and whistle. Every background artist behind the main leads doing overacting and over melodramatic acting that I didn't connect with. Emotional scene are full with loud BGM. I never seen anyone doing this. Instead of making us emotional I find it funny. One more aspect for not liking the movie is story telling . It too fast pace. There is a entry after entry of main leads with loud BGM throughout the film. There is scene in the movie where adhera hold the bridge with one hand and multiple jeeps are passing through it. There are many scenes of Yash which shows him a superhuman or video game character. Who will do this in real life. And one more drawback action scenes are closely shooted only there upper body is taken which resulted in less detail.In my conclusion the movie is over hyped it lags in content and acting may be the reason. Acting is average. Only appreciable thing is looks of the main leads to appeal the masses. If you doesn't want headache like me avoid the movie in theatre. You can wait for its OTT release. If you are going to watch it by seeing it's ratings please read my review and you will avoid your unbearable headache and dissing sound after the movie.
Waiting for chapter 3. What a direction ..what a mass..what an entertainment... rocky rocks .. bollywood please learn something from south ... kgf1 * 2 is kgf2.

One word Review: Outstanding!*STORYLINE/PLOT: Gripping, full of Twists and Turns and unpredictable sequences.*ACTING: Magnificent performances by Everyone. Yash as Rocky is beyond appreciation...like No other, Never seen such Grace, aura of some actor. Finest Action star till date in India. Expressions king at the time of Emotional, Romantic scenes. Sanjay Dutt as Adheera is cruel. You will hate him throughout as villian, that is talent of a good actor. His Finest performance till date. Raveena Tandon as PM is Amazing, great talent she is. Definitely knows what Expressions are required at which time. Never seen an actress playing PM so effortlessly. Srinidhi shetty as Reena is Beautiful and really Good actress. But is this enough?. Throughout the film, I pretty much felt that what's her role in the film?, who wrote her role...because it looks like she is just showpiece Beautiful girl who tries to engage in every possible place she can. Director even didn't tried to justify her presence. She is great talent but her Role in film reminds me of Bollywood actress playing sidekick in Kumar, Khan films...Rest, Every supporting Cast is best in their parts.*DIRECTION: Prashant Really did very fine job. His direction is effective. One after other Marvellous frames. Biggest up in direction is Running 2 or 3 events at one time. It keeps us looking up on the screen only. Action scenes are Directed like never before.The flawless CINEMATOGRAPHY, EDITING are Biggest ups.*SCREENPLAY & DIALOGUES: Very Engaging Screenplay. As mentioned, Audience keep hooked as effectively directed scenes runs continuously on screen and we don't find it Boring anytime. Dialogues have big hand in making this special. Credit goes to makers who took Hindi dubbing seriously and written dialogues so properly. Manytimes Dialogues along with Superb BGM give chills.*MUSIC: Conditional and Quality Songs. Amazingly written with proper BGM makes them giving Goosebumps. Even the Romantic song Mehbooba Ignited the emotions to extreme. After very long, some original and fantastic soundtrack.# FINAL VERDICT: When A Hardworking Cast and Crew are dedicated to make a Really class and Masterpiece film, then all of them comes at same pace of Excellence. This is what happened here. Definitely a Must watch!

Kgf1 was way better than this one . It was one of the best movie but in this 2nd part by taking Sanjay dutt and ravina they ruined the movie.Why did they have to copy Vikings Ragnar character here ? Sanjay Dutt, Raveena Tandon excelled in their performances. The mother sentiment song was not apt, felt like a sudden break in a glorified ride.Overall, the mass entertainer hits the bullseye and enjoyed to the core.

reviews.content: I don't usually enjoy the mass masala Indian movies. But i realised i didn't like them, because they were just not good. This movie stayed true to its genre. I got ehat i was expecting out of this movie.

Worth the hype !!!.... KGF chapter 2 , mass action thriller was really a great sequel . It completely satisfies the hype created by Part 1 . It's completely a Rocky Bhai's show , his characterisation and mannerism was pure lit . Mass action sequence , dialogues and buildup were just awesome as part 1 . Yash as Rocky Bhai gave terrific performance . Sanjay Dutt as Adheera was stunning in look , but his characterisation was not that much impressive as I thought . Raveena Tandon done her job well . Prashanth Neel way of handling commercial cinema is quite unique . First half was well made , screenplay was engaging , especially interval block . Second half was also good , but lagged in few places . This time mother sentiment quite didn't worked . Technically movie was great comparing to it's previous part , especially music and cinematography was mind blowing . Overall a well made sequel , please don't miss it to watch it on big screen .( but still KGF 1 second half >>>>>>>>> )

As someone said, "Sorry to say haters, film will be blockbuster", well I don't care if the film makes a lot of money or little. As an audience I don't judge films on how much of a success they get commercially, neither do I care about the commercial aspect of it.It's a mass market movie keeping typical Indian audience in mind so yeah it got that part right.Now coming to the horrendous things, The plot swings haphazardly between the past and the present. The VFX, I don't know which production did the majority works on it and how it got approved, felt armature, or may be the seer lack of making it good as the general audience isn't going to care anyway. The edit is bad like period, sometimes it shakes so much for random reason gave me a headache.The story I don't know mothers like "El Chapo" mother who wants their son to be criminal, and somehow that's all it takes for him to be the biggest criminal. "Mothers love". I mean why don't make a superhero film if the hero is going to be super anyway.None the less this is more like a typical South Indian movie with less logic, more action, cringe dialogues at slow motion & BGM to make them sound cool.Interestingly that's all it takes to make a successful movie in India and people will go all gaga over it.

reviews.review_title: salaam rocky bhai ilaka tera bhai tu hai sabka bhai
reviews.content: Prashanth Neel returns as writer-director in KGF: Chapter 2, starring Yash as the gold-hearted gangster named Rocky. But first, a recap. The first chapter was a Deewar-like story of a young boy coming to Bombay and becoming a famous gangster. And then, he is sent to Karnataka, where he becomes even more famous: he becomes the messiah of the people of a secret mining town called KGF. We met Rocky's enemies like Shetty bhai in Bombay and Inayat Khalil in Dubai. We met the Indian Prime Minister, a woman whose face was never revealed, a woman who spoke of unleashing the army on Rocky while signing the death warrant of the man she considered "the biggest criminal in India."But the film began with a television anchor played by Malavika Avinash. She listens to the KGF story as told by a senior journalist, played by Ananth Nag - and that is the same framing device Prashanth uses in the sequel as well. There's just one change. The narrator now is Prakash Raj, who plays the Ananth Nag character's son. I did not realise this while watching Chapter 1, but these conversations provide two things: a breather between the hectically paced events, and they are also a small bit of spoon-feeding for the audience, because the story is so deep and dense. No, let me correct that. The story is fairly uncomplicated. It's the narrative that's deep and dense. And we'll come to this later.So what does Chapter Two have in store for Rocky? He still cares for his people, who worship him. But he wants them to mine for gold day and night. "The work should not stop," he says. Why? I'll just tell you that it has to do with a mother and a bedtime story she tells her son. Watch the first scene carefully, because this makes the closing images so powerful, so mythical. And between this beginning and this ending, we get a film that works at two levels. One, we get a huge action spectacle with very inventive set pieces, superbly shot by Bhuvan Gowda in dark tones that indicate that we are watching a darker sequel. And two, we get a style-filled masala movie, filled with whistle-worthy dialogue and scene after scene with twists and surprises for the audience.In Chapter Two, Rocky has two new enemies: the Prime Minister, whose face is finally revealed and is played by Raveena Tandon, and a Viking-style brute named played by a terrific Sanjay Dutt. His entry scene on a burning bridge is one of the film's many epic highlights. In fact, every bit of this film is epic: Yash is epic and wonderfully larger-than-life, the dialogs are epic, Ravi Basrur's score is epic, and the action is epic, especially a car chase that keeps cutting to a black screen - but that is why I wished for some quiet, intimate moments between Rocky and his love interest, played by Srinidhi Shetty. We get an epic moment involving a helicopter, but we get no real idea about their relationship. Their great romance - if it is that - does not register at all. The second issue I had with the film was that the unmasking of the criminal mastermind was done too hastily.But that apart, I had no complaints, and we can now talk about the narrative being deep and dense. In Chapter One, the combination of the fast cutting and slow motion created a stylised effect. We get some of that in Chapter Two as well, but Prashanth really pushes himself as a screenwriter and he also pushes his editor Ujwal Kulkarni - to the extent that every sequence plays like the legendary baptism stretch from the first Godfather. The visuals come at us very fast, but this is not just the usual quick cutting for an attention-deficit audience. This is carefully planned stylisation. Take the scene where the Raveena Tandon character is sworn in as Prime Minister. She reads out a line or two. And then we see her elsewhere, barking orders to sack the Home Minister. And then, we are back at the swearing-in ceremony. So there is a sense of playing with time. We see her in the present. We cut to her actions in the future. And we return to the present. And there is also a sense of playing with geography, because these two events are happening in two different locations.This happens again and again. We have a no-confidence motion playing out in the Parliament. Simultaneously, we see a shootout. Rocky's wife has a bad dream. We move to a major action set piece, after which we return to the bad dream being narrated. This closing part of this narration is one of the few genuinely emotional moments in KGF: Chapter Two, along with the opening and closing imagery. But I didn't mind. The action and the masala flavour and the precision of the cuts are fantastic, and even if the story arc feels familiar, the denseness from the screenplay/editing makes it all seem new. Chapter Two improves on its predecessor: it is an epic times two.

I thought I gave K. G. F Chapter 1 a glowing review. I spoke about Yash/Rocky's on screen presence, how he dominated every frame he was in, how he was a force of nature onto himself. I spoke about the amazing director who was able to put together such a fine series of films. I even spoke about the incredible outfits and songs and music.K. G. F Chapter 2 is a beautiful and fitting close to the series. Unless K. G. F Chapter 3 is coming, in which case it was an amazing center of the series.K. G. F Chapter 2 definitely gives us a much better romance to look forward to. In chapter 1 I called it weird, as I was unsure 99% of the time, if Reena liked him or loved him or was being forced by him. Yet in chapter 2 we see her learning about him, loving him and in the end marrying him. All I've got to say to that is he is one hellava lucky man. Reena and Rocky, they seem made for one another and while Rocky's mum set him out on his path. Reena is the only one now who can temper his anger and pull him back before he goes to far. She is crucial to the path he takes and the actions that he takes along it. (Did I mention that she is drop dead gorgeous? Like seriously Srinhidi Shetty is absolutely stunning!)Before this review gets any longer let's end it here and now by saying simply, Chapter 2 has it all: To die for Romance, powerful storyline, amazing cast, top-notch acting, amazing visuals, sfx and vfx.All that was required to turn this movie into a massive success. 10/10 from me!

reviews.review_title: WoW! That was above than expectation for me..
reviews.content: It's a little trivia about my life. After the end of 1st wave of Covid-19 theatres reopened and I went to Maharaja Multiplex, BBSR to watch it's 1st installment and the theatrical experience of the 1st part was just wow and I could easily rate that 8 out of 10 stars from my side. That was my last movie in theatre and after a year I went to theatre Cineplex, Keonjhar to watch it's 2nd installment. Ha ha so basically my last 2 movies in theatres are KGF 1 & 2 .Now coming into the main review. Rocky bhai continued his journey where he left in the first part and this time he is not a Local don of Mumbai region,he is now the Lord of KGF. Everyone Loves him, everyone prays for him because he set everyone free from cruel ruler and he is the new king of that KGF. So the acting performance of Yash is no doubt above then excellence. Actually lots of credits goes to Cameraman and VFX team especially the editor for showing Yash's action sequence with BGM in different different angles. Absolutely loved it. The performance of Adheera (Sanjay Dutt) and Raveena Tandon was also very good. The casting director and the makeup artist made perfect replica of Vikings and Indira Gandhi respectively with their characters. BGM and Music of this KGF 2 will chill your spine. I will say Just Go and watch with your family. It's completely OKEY to watch this film with family because it doesn't have any kind of adult content in it, violence are also perfectly blended in it, kudos to Prashant Nill, the director of this movie.I can't talk much about this movie because I have enjoyed it so so much and not a single point to cut it's ratings, well you have to leave your logic in your home otherwise you will feel how the hell physics works here ha ha (Jokes apart) 10 Out of 10 Stars from my side.

I watched after all the buzz created so started to watch with great expectations. It died very early. Still wanted to finish the second chapter.The plot is An interesting premise the kollar gold field captured by a guy who built his steps brick by brick. However the presentation of hypermasculanity to do so is a serious flaw of this series. The script and the dialogues are all whistle worthy however there are so many plotholes.And the love angle is filled with how not to show romance 101 . Take an example of how he calls her "entertainment". How she waits for him hungry in the table etc etc. I can understand the protagonist comes from slum so his behavior and etiquette will not be feminist. But in my opinion there are lot of scenes which could be avoided. Srineedhi on top of that has given confusing expressions throughout the movie. You don't connect with her character at all.Disappointed.

reviews.review_title: Commendable Action Scenes Powerful Acting&Swag Less Intriguing Storyline
reviews.content: So gave a watch to the most hyped film ever, it was a good one time watch action thriller with very amazing action scenes and powerful acting but a bit not so exciting story that keeps you glued to the screens and make you wonder wt will happen next(Though the ending was commendable). Yash does a really good job with his swag and also carries action scenes amazingly well, Srinidhi shetty here gets a lengthier role compared to the 1st part and she also does well especially in the climax scene with her emotions, Raveena tandon also makes her presence felt and she as well does a good job with her expressions and bossy attitude, Sanjay dutt ws extra ordinary as the main antagonist adheera and he does a really commendable performance. The action of the film is vry well directed and structured, wat i didn't like was the story had no vry intriguing depth that can justify the film in overall. Nevertheless despite some flaws KGF 2 is a great one time watch action thriller film, I rate it 7/10 starz.

Just finished the Movie.The First half was lacking a bit, and was just going average.The main actor is alright But annoying at times.But the screenplay and writing was saving all of that.2nd part just kept going strong Right til the end. What a Movie. And the scale of it. Just woow.Chapter 1 and 2 is a must watch. And better than mostly any Bollywood Movie made.Im deffo in for more Movies from South india in the future.

Never ever have done this type of masterpiece.Story, action, suspens, cinematography everything is totally outstanding.Rocky and Adhira Are too deadly👹
Must must must must watch 😎

Positive points first:-First, in start of the movie, there is some little bit COMEDY which i liked it.Second, the background music (BGM) of the movie is so amazing, but it becomes so loud sometimes which feels irritating.Third, in terms of ACTING, the actor & actresses performed very well except some. Specially, Yash who performed as rocky bhai, his acting was so realistic and cool.Fourth, the CINEMATOGRAPHY of the movie was beyond my imagination. I like the way, how they played with LIGHTS to make the frame more amazing.Fifth, the STORY is also quite good. I appreciate that it is different from the usual concept of action movies. I mean, most of the movies showed the journey of powerless guy who later become the hero of that particular industry, like kgf 1. But its second part is different from it. However, i wanted to watch more politics in this movie of capturing the KGF.Sixth, this point doesn't matter so much, but, seriously i like the COSTUMES of rocky bhai. They supported his character.Seventh, as i wrote in the title, the ATTITUDE of the gangster is so cool. In short, from acting, character development, costumes to the attitude- rocky bhai rocks in each field. I mean rocky/yash is the lifeline of this movie.Eighth, personally, i don't like the love angle of the movie, but still the impact of the DEATH hits and well plotted.Ninth, the SETS are also amazing according to the movie.Now, let's talk about some NEGATIVE points :-First, why they INTENSIFIES each and every dialogue. It is so dramatic and annoying. Even they intensifies the small situations of no need with the help of loud BGM.Second, personally, i objects the statement- "you are my entertainment". I know, that they doesn't have any wrong intention, but still on an individual level, i found this statement wrong.Third, the ACTION SCENES, they cross the limits of the reality. They are so illogical, but they are intense and entertaining.Fourth, in the car chase scene, the screen starts blinking on and off continuously. I don't know that it is the mistake of my video player or of their cinematography. But it is annoying.Fifth, the CHARACTER DEVELOPMENT of the movie is average, or may be below average.Sixth, as i said earlier, that the LOVE between two main characters is not so Impactful or entertaining.Seventh, this point is so important, because in most of the action movies, the villians are the main source of intense fights. But in this movie, the VILLIAN performed not so good. They disappointed me.

A very great job has been done by the Director+Writer Prashanth Neel sir. How They are making the kannada industry more bigger than the bollywood and many other cinema.The Acting of Yash as Rocky Bhai was fantastic mind blowing. No one can criticize him or the film because of the finest work and hardwork made by the whole crew and production member.We are appreciate this film and loved to watch the Chapter 3,4,5 and so on
And also we want this universe.

How did they made this masterpiece with 100 crores?THIS IS THE PRIDE OF INDIAN CINEMACasting, Cinematography, Music, Visual, Editing, and screenplay was perfect....SUPER ACTING BY ROCKING STAR YASH....

reviews.review_title: Chapter 2 is Stylish with slick Action
reviews.content: KGF Chapter 2 keeps up the momentum of Chapter 1. The action sequences are choreographed well and gels well with the story. The background score and cinematography is first rate. There are flashback to the time spent with Rockys mom which is done very well.Yash as Rocky gives crediblity to his character and has a strong screen presence.The characters of Sanjay Dutt as Adheera and Raveena Tandon as Ramika give good support.There are some over the top scenes which does not have logic like walking into parliament and gunning down minister and shooting down a police station all with no resistance .Prashant Neel has done a great job and can say that he exceeded the mammoth expectation that he had set after Chapter 1.

reviews.review_title: Highly Overrated movie of the cinematic era
reviews.content: After so much hype around the movie, I had watched it in a full packed theatre with great sound system and found myself closing my ears for the loud unnecessary background score. The movie had black out cuts during a car chase sequence and I was surprised, didn't understand a thing that why on earth anyone will edit a car chase in that manner lost my patience there. Throughout the movie I saw only elevations about the protagonist, people come praise him and leave one scene after other. I had a lot of expectation from the movie I really wanted this to be a well written one. But the story lacks emotions I felt no connection towards any character in the movie. The cinematographer had only close shots he didn't capture things well. The camera movements will cause eye ache during Adheera and Rocky fight one on one right after Reena's death. I can go on and on and on with the flaws in the movie but I am wondering how people have become blinded and support this kind of a movie which didn't have any field excelled at any level. Apart from Ananth Nag in the whole of KGF franchise I have not seen a single actor perform well. Yash was all about walking, throwing punch dialogues, I didn't see him act at all. He had a straight face. The villain was weak and for god sake the costume that rocky wears during his meet with prime minister of India is the costume of Allu Arjun in ala vaikuntapuramulo. Atleast they could have changed the Color. It's totally overrated and doesn't deserve what it is enjoying now. Hope Prashanth Neel will atleast give a good movie in his next.
The first one felt like a trailer in front of the second one. Damn the performances by Yash and Sanjay Dutt were superb. The cinematography and the background score were like a Hollywood movie.

Theres no word invented to expalin about this film Much better vfx than RRR. I wasted my money on RRR that is main regret. U can experience all things in this film action romance sentimental side of mother Unlimited SWAG of Rocky.

Wonderful awesome no words to describe this movie a complete entertainer with huge goosebumps . Everyone please experience it in theatre. Best direction best acting by prashanth neel and yash sir. Just superb movie and waiting for KGF Chapter-3.

This movie is edited better than its predecessor. The action set pieces are explosive in a way we rarely seen in indian cinema. Cinematography is beautiful. However none of that can overcome the fact that i had no emotional connection with the hero and his motivation. But i already expected that because of chapter 1 so it didn't bother me as much.

reviews.review_title: Grander than life a little low on story
reviews.content: There were many awe and ooh moments despite them it felt over stretched but didn't disappoint. I must say, rickey brains character has a separate fan base just one glimpse people are ready to buy tickets the characterisation was at its best, again you couldn't guess what's about to happen in the film at all times and it's a very big achievement considering it as an action film, only thing that I felt was missing is more action and a better end to the part, it's a good film no doubt but it was meant to be the best, it also lacked the grip over audience so In my opinion if it was15 to 20 minutes shorter film could've done the trick, all in all a good film.

After the success of Bahubali phenomenon , many movies are trying to recreate the same. KGF has also tried to do the same by splitting the movie into two parts. But, KGF fall flat in its 2nd part where Bahubali succeeded.Coming to movie, this movie is all about hype. It's lacks story. It is too noisy. Their are only few dialogues that people will remember. The whole movie looks like a big trailer.If you are Yash fan then you may enjoy the movie otherwise it can be skipped.

reviews.review_title: Average at best, this film does the style way better than the substance
reviews.content: KGF Chapter II will remain one of the most technically sound films made in India. Be it the expansive set design or the brilliant camerawork or even those lavish suits that Rocky wears, or the makeup on Adheera, KGF's technical department deserves all praise for making a grand contribution to this magnum opus BUT it is the story and overdose of machismo that makes a dent in the experience and leaves an average aftertaste. It might have the so-called spices that makes up a summer blockbuster but the screenplay is quite immaterial, hardly written with thought and care, and even to a point predictable. And Raveena Tandon does the finest in the acting department while the others only scream and yell - if only that could be called acting?! Yash does fine in getting the commanding presence required of his messiah plus gangster plus monster image in Rocky but his style and panache does get in the way of actual emoting. Also dubbing in Hindi could have been better.

I dont have any words to tell about this movie, words are not enough to describe the greatness of this movie. It is Never before and ever after Movie
It is an Unbreakable and UnStoppable Movie.Name:"KGF"
Chapter 1,2,3.

reviews.review_title: A saga worthy to be called one of Indias great

KGF CHAPTER 2 this movie was awesome yash was electrifying like in the first part Sanjay dutt has done a phenomenal job in his character "ADHEERA". It was like Hollywood type film...

NO- logic, depth of story, connection with reality, risky stunts, high budget car chases
BUT YOU CAN'T AVOID this film if you are an action loving Indian cine goer.Probably the best second part ever. Dialogues ,BGM, Just a few well written characters can make a regular action film into a remarkable film franchise - Kudos to Team KGF.

reviews.review_title: World Class Indian Fare. One of the best motion pictures period!
reviews.content: KGF 2 starts out with a lot of dark images but hand on to your hats. Everything about this motion picture is over the top. By the time it is done, it has blown your socks away!Incredible direction, incredible editing, incredible music and background score, mind numbing action with an emotional story to back the entire franchise.Hindi Cinema needs to wake up and wake up fast otherwise it will fade away fast........ There is no film in Bollywood that even comes close to KGF 2. Even Hollywood cannot match this epic.Simply wow! Breathtaking. And Yash, a superstar in the true sense.

reviews.review_title: Prashanth Neel is Zack Snyder on steroids and KGF Chapter 2 is his amusement park!!!!
reviews.content: Prashanth and his team have done a swell job in whipping up an eye-catching escapist movie. Despite its innate flaws, one cannot deny the fact that it works to a great extent. Some movies speak to us at personal, psychological and emotional levels, and some other films offer experiences that are akin to jolly rides at an amusement park.

KGF 2 was a good movie but it was not worth the hype. The action sequences were marvelous but the story plot was very weak. More than half of the movie just focuses on the style of main hero. KGF 1 was far better in terms of story , emotions and plot twists. But still its a go for action lovers.

reviews.review_title: Full of style but typical misogynist
reviews.content: Overall a nice movie. But as grand as hero is shown for his morals and humanity...even he fails basic humanity to respect female counterpart. The way heroin is captured by the lead and stated as "for my entertainment" is outright disgraceful and hardly heroic.

"K. G. F: Chapter 2" is a high-octane action film that showcases some exceptional performances by its lead actors. Yash delivers an energetic and powerful performance, bringing a strong physicality and intensity to his role. Raveena Tandon also gives a good performance, her role of a prime minister on screen looks like a real politician. Sanjay Dutt's role as a villain is not as strong as the other characters, but he makes up for it with his menacing look and mind-blowing acting. The film's dialogue delivery is sharp and well-written, adding depth to the characters and their motivations. The cinematography and action sequences are top-notch and the film has a great pacing that keeps the audience engaged throughout. However, the death of lead actress Srinidhi Shetty was a heart-falling moment in the movie and it was not expected by the audience. Overall, "K. G. F: Chapter 2" is a thrilling action film that is sure to entertain fans of the genre.

What a movie..This movie is a gem in indian cinemas...Awesome direction, cinematography, bgm, acting, etc etc.... YASH has nailed as ROCKY BHAAI...Sanju babaa was lit...Raveena was fantastic...tottally its a toofaan at indian box office.

reviews.review_title: A must watch for any type of movie lover
reviews.content: Do you like comedy, go for it! Do you like fight? Watch this movie without fail! Do you like to watch the best cinematography? You shouldn't miss this movie. Do you like to watch the movie with best of best dialogues? You have to watch this movie. Do you like movie without too much of drama? Ha ha, then this is for you. Do you like to watch the movie where you need to use your brain to understand? Yes, this is for you. Ah! 1 movie that can satisfy different expectations. Loved it, thanks to the whole team of kgf.

reviews.review_title: Excessive slow motion scenes and typical hero centric south indian cinema
reviews.content: It's high time the audience have scene heroes doing wonders in South movies. Yet the raw style of Yash and dialogs are treat to watch.. Only annoying thing is the excessive slow motion scenes and again no logic movie made in 2 parts. The main character (Rocky) does every thing only to fulfill his mother's wish. Then dies in the end with all gold. Common guys you could have done better than that.

I have to say this with a heavy heart that the potential of this movie was so high after the amazing prequel but sadly it got absolutely butchered.I didn't like the rushed plot full of holes, the extremely loud music burying the dialogues, poor visuals despite the enormous budget.But the one thing that completely ruined the movie for me was the frequent hyping up moments (let me explain): We know that Rocky's a badass after the impression given to us by the prequel, so why does this movie try so hard to prove it again and again giving us this crowd roaring moments every 5 minutes only to make the audience less hyped and energized after each roar?The dialogues were quite good but at times some of the dialogues felt like it was written by a 14 yr old heavily influenced by the swag of Salman Bhai.The feud between Rocky and Adheera also didn't hit the spot. The film succeeded in portraying Adheera as a fearsome character (at the beginning) but his fearful presence was degraded after he just casually shot Rocky (who was all alone) from the comfort of his army being around him. Rocky then took his revenge by doing the same which then fueled their final battle which was an utter disaster mainly due to poor choreography, visuals and a scene transition every second.What a big disappointment for a movie awaited for 4 years!

Who knows what happened after lead actress fell in love in the lead and story starts with a very unexpectedly different angle. First half was good, ends makes no sense.)That's my review 👆🏻
#KGFChapter2.

reviews.review_title: Messed up movie with soul-less script
reviews.content: The movie is terribly overrated. The movie is full of build ups, unnecessary elevations and very less story. Action scenes are horribly edited and messy. Loose script, repititive mother emotion scenes and loud music for the most of screen time.The plot of the movie just revolves around between multiple faceoffs between the villain and hero and villain letting go the hero (without killing) and vice versa. The vilain is just for namesake and his character doesn't have any depth. He uses guns along with swords to fight which seems ridiculous.The heroine is reduced to a showpiece and has no role whatsoever. In the police station scene, the hero shoots mindlessly and everyone watches him without slightest resistance/defence.The good things are the cinematography (never seen before in any Kannada movie) and acting performance by Raveena.Loud and unnecessary BGM haunts you throughout the movie. The director has not bothered about script and screenplay at all.The good things are the cinematography (never seen before in any Kannada movie till date) and acting performance by Raveena.The movie feels uncomfortable, loud, mindlessly directed, hyper heroic and leaves you with a headache at the end.

No words for justify the movie only goosebumps 💯💯💯💯💯🔥and the rocking star yash is on fire in the movie on all time and waiting for chapter.......3 and the villain of movie is better and all characters are done nice work and results is 1200 Cr + collection.

reviews.content: You can see Mad Max 300 all black and dust! Not at all a impressive movie. Just extreme loud sounds. I don't understand the obsession with black color and dust. Not much impressive dialogs and quite predictable.

This has to be one of the best action packed thrillers of India. The dialogues, cinematography, fight sequences and the storey brings out every emotion possible. This one isn't a one time watch, people will surely Bing watch its epic scenes for years to come.

reviews.review_title: Excellent Movie comparing to other kannada movies
reviews.content: This movie is excellent comparing to other kannada movies.After watching RRR i felt kgf is half of RRR.KGF is also really a good movie but not matches the hype created all-over the world.Excellent dialogues. Yash acted really well.

1) the hero says he wants to "keep" the heroine by his side for entertainment who later in the movie falls in love with him 2) only women are shown crying when there are "emotional" scenes making it seem like men have no emotions 3) the hero is not a hero in this chapter. He's a glorified villain.

Prashanth Neel clearly knows how to elevate a mass scene and how to present a goosebumps scenes to the audience. That's what he did in the Movie, placing goosebumps scenes at every 5 minutes on his screenplay. Rocky is larger than life character.. No he's more than that so it's not easy to convince the audience that whatever he does but Neel convincingly delivered it. He created a dark World called KGF and pulled the audience into it to see the Action adventure of Rocky. People love rebellious stories but here Rocky was not completely a Rebel but people in kgf see him as the one, that's also the main reason audience loving this movie.Yash has the dynamic screen presence as Rocky. His attitude and actions were the big plus to pull down this Mega character. But Ravi Basrur is the real monster here, he Rocked the every scene of the movie. But same like kgf 1 i didn't like the editing style of Neel, it's giving headache. The other technical aspects were amazing to watch in big screen. With this budget they pulled off a stunning quality of making in many Points.Now the things that I didn't like was Neel has the ability to pull off the commercial scenes with high octane moments but at the same time he's not concentrating on the logics and the loopholes in the Screenplay. Because of people enjoying the High octane scenes they're forgetting/forgiving the logicless writing, but how long can he survive like that coz at a point people become fatigue by watching same repeated stuffs, so he must concentrate on his writing. He got the superb core story involving a mother son relationship and a Place like hell that dying for a Saviour and the Saviour becoming a National issue.. with this kind of story I expected a super solid screenplay from Neel but a disappointment for me. So personally I felt as an average commercial Movie with Adrenaline rising moments.Overall KGF is a crowd puller.. definitely a treat for Action movie lovers. A perfect masala entertainer.

The genre of K. G. F-2 should have been Fantasy. Pure Fantasy.Though the storyline of the movie is thin, they have made it up with excellent screenplay and filmography. Absolutely enjoyed the movie. But the fight sceen with boss enemy could have been trimmed a little. Performance of Ravina Tondon and Sunjay Dutt are mindblowing.

I don't like to watch TV, Movies and etcs... because i wouldn't have so much time for watching.But one of my friend had suggested me that you must watch KGF CHAPTER 2 Movie andhe had booked my ticket as well and he said , I'll never be able to forget that experience and he was right... that's experience I'll never forget... What a experience. What a movie...
Thanks to my friend who had suggested me...
And Thanks to TEAM OF KGF ...
MUST WATCH MOVIE !!I became fan of Yash.

To be honest I love the movie VFX. The movie going through was actually osm. Color effects of this movie was splendid. Every character plays a dynamic role. Fighting between Rocky and adheera were fantastic also sounds effect was hard. I love the weapon use in this movie. Storyline of this movie was getting excited.Overall I love to watch this movie and waiting for chapter 3.

The movie had mass moments. But there was many logic mistakes. Villain shot the protagonist on chest and it is not lethal. He lets him live. It was a comedy. Instead of killing the female lead with sniper like shot, villain could have ended the protagonist. Like this many logic mistakes all around the movie. reviews.content: Yeah, the action scenes, the cinematography, background music, fight scenes, magnificent attitude of the hero everything's gonna give you goosebumps. But where is the emotion? reviews.review_title: Unfortunate that kannada film also taken into action
reviews.content: Great movie with good visuals but Current days news show how film industry is impacting Indian people and how heroes become role models in youngsters life than just seeing entertainment and how movie stars have responsibility towards society is greater in the current day than ever. Many news showcasing how youngster take wrong path.

The movie is well made, the cinematography, styling, screenplay is top notch.All the fast editing and loud background score really helped to hide the plot holes and the lack of logic.Go for it if you just want to have fun with friends and be prepared for deafening background scores (cotton helped me).

Warning: SpoilersThe film's narration is so fast that, if you don't focus, you miss some part of the story. That's why some ppl say 'there is no plot in the movie', 'leave your brain in your house', etc.I watched it twice on an OTT platform. The subplots are seamlessly connected together - and subtext provided :) - like, the CBI clock not working, and later on, Raghavan correcting it. Also, the PM's strategy changes after Rocky's 1st interaction with her, and then after he kills Guru Pandian.There is nothing confusing or illogical (like Inception, Matrix) or trivial (needless comedy and songs). The narration is fast, that's all. The only annoying thing for me was that I had to change the volume for fights and dialogues. But the BGM is so good that I forgot about it.I had read about illogical fight scenes and Rocky's assaults on the parliament and police station. When I saw those scenes, I also saw our hypocrisy - we accept Superman and Spiderman flying in the air and jumping between buildings, or the 3 Idiots hero-turned-midwife delivering a baby - but Rocky cannot fight multiple ppl. I will convince you guys - his mother gave him the superpower, okay? Think that, and we are good to go :).Two 'pleasant' surprises in the film - (1) Raveena Tandon's acting is excellent. I hope she gets more such roles. Rocky worships Kali but a Kali-like Prime Minister baits him in the end.Side note - Some called his 'Entertainment' dialogue as sexist, but did not notice that it is a woman who brought him down in the end.(2) There is no preachy idealism and pretensions of doing good to society - Greed is good :).Rocky is Yash. Rocky is you and me - a human being shaped by their circumstances. And even though the director does not want to give a social message - ironic - there are many things to learn from Rocky's story, many more than from Inception, Matrix, Superman and Spiderman... Salaam, KGF team !Update - May 21: Hindi version review. I saw twice in Kannada. Not one moment was boring, again :).Sanjay Dutt appears clumsy in the Kannada version but his original voice makes him convincing.With her original voice, Raveena Tandon gives me 'Smitha Patil' vibes :). Man, you can create roles and scripts around her.
Ohhh... What a movie. My waiting for a better quality in OTT worth it. The Style is the center focus of this movie. What a style it caught. I don't how many times I uttered 'WOW'.

reviews.review_title: Good masala for typical Indian viewers..
reviews.content: Such movies provide perfect masalas for Indian viewers -- especially for folks in down south who mostly prefers actors making people fly in air with his dhoti.. (jk). Lol.. Anyway, it's more of a gold/coal mafias that's possible existent in parts of the country, but this story doesn't relate at best level.. And honestly, entering parliament and killing minister is just another joke in Indian movies..

Firstly, this is the masterpiece till made in Hindi cinema and also my favourite movie ever which is made in Hindi cinema. Direction, screenplay , cinematography, actors, environment, songs ,background songs, BGM, all the actors , these are all the masterpiece. Now I am very curious how they will execute the next part of that is KGF chapter 3. I am very thanks to the Tamil cinema which made this masterpiece and also all the staff and cru members which makes movie you will better than Hollywood. It also show to the world how Indian cinema is best bestest and every time bestest. The acting of Yash superstar and Sanjay Dutt and all the other supported characters are fantastic.

Don't expect any kind of logic while watching these types of movies. Well, the director tried his best to make it logical, but failed. But that has not failed to make the viewers crazy and watch it. The movie is full of hardcore action, where Yash and Sanjay Dutt clash with each other to take control over the KGF. There is no boring scene. You will feel goosebumps when you watch it at a theatre. This movie deserves to be seen at big screen. Background music makes the movie more rocking, thanks to the music director.

reviews.review_title: No SPoiler of any sort. Just explaining my POV and possible mistakes.
reviews.content:
= No SPOILER, nothing. Only talking vaguely and giving my own opinion without any mirch masala. =Let me be honest and tell you the problems. Lol
---
First thing first, I enjoyed the movie. :D
Now regarding problems and Over the top actions sequences and many egocentric decisions took place throughout the movie. Even the fact that life of a boy was decided by his mother,even though i won't argue, but still it felt a bit forced, but i know, it's not bad, kinda swayed the whole vibe for me as such things only take place when we think about villains = as in cruel treacherous villains, you know what i mean, right. As we always say, see his past is the reason for him being like that =
But for Rocky i have a different feeling. He is more like a Antagonist but not a villain. It's like he has that vibe and the aura. He is like a person you wanna cheer for. So i was always thinking of him as MC. But now i think he is, Anti-Hero kinda being. Which is also my favourite genre btw.---
Over the top actions could be a bit problematic, but they made it such a fast show of actions that it didn't really bother me. I get that from the first action scene, They are not trying to show me how well he fight.They are just trying to set the tone and Let people's imagination run wild. Which IMO is a very good way to avoid OTT Action and at the same time having a similar impact, if nothing less.---
So TBH not much of a problem anywhere.Latest movies released like,
RRR and BEAST.ALL have problem with logic and actions were so illogical and let's say done with idiocy that i was kinda sad. But still, they all did one thing.Giving us anime style fight scenes which you can enjoy with popcorn.But still by the end i has this complaint in my mind. Like, why do this? Why your knee suddenly become allright that you can jump run, while just a min. Ago you can't even walk. How can broken knee just become allright, when soldiers specifically break them and didn't even gave you enough food and so on. SO it was so much, that finally i stopped my brain like
It's ENOUGH, just stop. See this as you are seeing anime.That's it.OTT Action was much less in BEAST. But still, fighting with sword against soldiers who are fighting with AK-47, and so on. Was so stupid. That again i stopped my brain.---
BUT in KGF Part 2 and even in part 1. They didn't give that much of a vibe of OTT ACtion going on. Which i loved. So i must say, I love their execution.That's it.Believe me, don't go for spoilers.It's a great movie.And they made it a fast movie, with blood pumping all around. Adrenaline and everything will just burst. Didn't get bored even for a sec.I got to see Rocky bhai rise, his fall, even him being egoist and even changing toward this greedy and bad person, and also see how his people tried to bring him back to his previous Rocky, only to get things worse as his enemies attack. And he lost everything. And again he rises.And as we all know, as a criminal rocky will eventually die. So no suspense in that. But still his journey was worth seeing.

reviews.review_title: Great Production quality BUT "Paisa Wasool Entertainer"...
reviews.content:
To sum up in a line - "Has to do with the craze, hype, expectation, strategy, pulse of the audience and the PRODUCTION QUALITY"To untie the strings of the rope,1. EXPECTATION WAS KING
Expectation is what made us sit in the cinema hall for a whole 3 hours for this movie.2. WOW PRODUCTION QUALITYCongrats, there is a promising production banner that is fit to build and raise movies as brands, bringing up awaiting films by promising story tellers. Producer is doing Hollywood level fiction movie crazy stuff with really viable money. He has achieved a grand production quality with comparatively less money. A 100 crore budget is killer value.3. STORY STRENGTH WAS... BADYes it made 1000 crores, but wait till I untie it. It's a great business success. In terms of story continuation, this is one of the good blunders that script writers can offer the intellect audience....The How...
Prashanth Neel who had built a great justifiable story line for kgf 1, now has broken its value. He has broken the legs on which kgf 1 actually stood strong on. The character whom people loved, has made way into things which it shouldn't be doing.ACTUALLY THE PROMISE WAS BROKEN.The moral way of upbringing by mom, his situations, situations at the mine, his mentality had nothing to do with him when he was a ruler.No mother will be proud of a kid who goes and becomes the sultan of a place to do the same cruelty which the mother experienced in her life.His mom never said him to be cruel and careless to make more struggling mothers like her.WORST CHARACTER JUSTIFICATION
Rocky rules the same way as Garuda, no respect or kindness at the lives of the thousands, including kids, the slavery
continues but at HIGHER PACE.The human values are not concerned, but tragically the human values itself built this character in the first part. PPL initially connected with this character due to qualities of natural hunger, kind moments and helping poor people understand their self esteem. But they are destroyed mindlessly in this sequel. These leave the character worst justified at the end, making blunder with a good character.4. PULSE OF AUDIENCE IS CAUGHTEven Garuda was powerful in kgf 1, but PPL didn't connect with him to raise voice for him. But they connected with rocky character bcz of certain good elements shown at instances in kgf 1.Now when Rocky does bad things like garuda now, the audience shout, whistle, bcz they know from kgf 1 that he is the hero of this film. Their job is just to support the leads. It's called CONVINCED MENTALITY.Prasant knows this and understands just what a major chunk needs. He said he cares about the business of the cinema more, so maybe he kept the story plot aside, as he knew that PPL would go crazy with non-stop action scenes playing one after another, which was enough for him.5. UNNECESSARY STORY ELEMENTSAdhera. He was only here to create craze, more craze. To add some more unrealistic or uninteresting old school fight scenes. Even if you take the character Adheera away, the story runs very well and even the cinema. Bcz, his part just enters at random times, when the hero has no other obstacles to handle. He comes irregularly. He seems kind of Hit and Run. His intentions though were told, did not catch the minds very much. He seemed like a goonda or a supari killer attacking a famous person.And the Scene of Mastermind Reveal behind all the KGF incidents. The worst. Many didn't even notice it coming and the scene slipped in seconds leaving many not even to notice it. Many who saw the movie don't even remember this scene.6. I LOVED IT MOMENTS
And hey buddy, I love the climax. And even some scenes specific. Well created. Climax stands out, bcz it does connect deeply with the emotions of the audience. The promise uttering in the background, him drowning, every gold biscuit diving turning, and his tremendous idea to take all gold from anybody's hold, I liked it. Especially the idea that he promised his mother to give her all the gold and now he is going to his mother ( ocean/earth/water is even a mother ) and how he presents it to her metaphorically, director's cap effort.7. THE REAL HEROES
Grading, VFX, cinematography is really an elevation and in reality is the real jaw dropping point to many international audiences. The DOP department has grown in skill. The Viking shots, the action sequence shooting, the car chasing scenes, the backgrounds. Art department needs hats off, it has crossed its limits.8. MUSIC, BGM, CRAZE
BGM? Great, but wait... It has to do with the past. KGF CHAPTER 1.Ravi Basrur could have flowed innovative sounds, variant tones, different pitches, different joner sounds. There's a monotony that's similar to sharp roaring stretched to 3 hours. The bgm of kgf 2 is mostly a better produced version of its preceding one. No changes, it seemed just loudened, tweaked with extra bass and noise. No memorable songs. Remixes of ch.1 are played.9. REALLY WHERE IT WENT WRONGThe first part was almost PLOT DRIVEN and yea even Character driven as I told you before, but suddenly the next part of the sequel turned out to be extreme masala mass Paisa vasool action compilation, and no interesting story. This is what threw the intellect audience's breaths down.10. WAS IT REALLY INTENSE?It was fast enough to make the audience confused. Many things didn't happen, but it happened very fast and quickly, enough for audience to say "INTENSE"
Reviewer Kairam Vaashi said that when he was watching the movie, he pondered over the cars and thought, "Did These Skoda Cars exist at those times?" and shared that he felt this, though he had seen the same cars in chapter 1, he didn't feel this question while watching that car in chapter 1. This shows another dimension where it went wrong. In such an intense no eye-blink kind of fast pace movies, if you can notice and ponder such details like what was written on the gun, car model etc, i.e if you can materialize the set even along with connecting with the pace and story, then it says the emptiness/predictable nature of the scenes going on that makes room for such thinking time. Only one thing that could have filled it was an intense story line that matches the pace of the movie.Not all fast moving movies are intense.
No one can beet this movie In terms of Screen play and Storey ,great songs,best songs, nice dialogue overall masterpic of south movies best performance of all actors .

reviews.review_title: A MUST WATCH MOVIE BEFORE ONE DIES & THIS WILL REMAIN IN THE LIST OF GREATEST MOVIE OF THE INDIAN CINEMA
reviews.content: KGF" originally a kannada movie dubbed in Hindi, Tamil, Telugu, & Malayalam is realised in 2000 screens worldwide.This movie is going to Blockbuster in the entire cine world for sure. I think it won't be wrong if I say that this movie has a potential of breaking all records of Indian Cinema.

What a blockbuster movie. This movie is proof that South Film industry of India has completely ruled over the Bollywood industry. Movies of Bollywood such as Anek, Kangana's Dhaakad or Akshay's Prithviraj have become undeniably zero in front of the applauding success of KGF Chapter 2.Indeed the movie has made history and I am not going to give any spoilers from the movie as an action movie fan, one should experience this thrilling movie on his own either on OTT or in theatres. But after you get done watching this masterpiece, you will have no choice but to appreciate the director Prashanth Neel's work as even though the film had quite a simple story, the presentation is what made it remarkable. Either being the moral of the story that circumstances of life turning a good guy into a bad guy or a mother's eternal love, one will only indulge and cherish the essence the movie carried during one's watch time.

KGF is what you get when a highly motivated team gets to work and it shows up on the screen. Yash (Rocky) delivers a performance of a lifetime in this magnus opus and is ably supported by the surrounding characters - three cheers to Shrinidhi Shetty (Reena) who debuted with the KGF series.Technically this is just top-notch stuff and I wouldn't be suprised if it ends up winning most of this year's awards. A special note to the BGM scorer (Ravi Basrur) who has composed like a man possessed! Cinematography is excellent by Bhuvan Gowda and the art sets by Shiva Kumar is outstanding - again, how did they achieve all this in such a feeble budget?

This movie will go down as the one of the finest movies that is made in the history of cinema, such a powerful presence of the bond between mother and child that surpasses all the worldly power is the most fascinating feeling of the movie.

Best for goosebumps and rocking Star agar dekhna chahte ho to dekh sakte ho movie me koi kami nhi hai. Or is budget me jo director ne kaam karke diya hai vo mind-blowing hai.

KGF chapter 2 is final chapter of KGF saga. KGF both movies are no doubt best action movies in indian cinema with list of bahubali and RRR, but Prashant neel need to learn from rajamauli on how to conclude a movie. It appears Director is under a lot of pressure of expectation. A story must make it forward naturally but here it has forced to reach a end and to cover all character. Although this movie has already made a history. I have analysed this movie on different aspects.1. Story: Chapter 2 is full of loopholes and forced narration. Although this story has a connection to common man but it not truely explain why a mother want his son to become most powerful man on earth but not tell any ethics ?..He just want to be powerful with no ethics and he is hero of the movie.2. Direction: Very confused and reaching nowhere till end occur in a forced way. Many scenes are appeared without logic and this shows director is very confused with respect to expectation from first part.(7/10)3. Acting: All actors have done justice to their roles but this film does not provide character justification and importance, such as Adheera. Director should give more depth to these characters but he misses.(7/10)4. Action: Full on best part of movie(10/10).5. Music & Background score: Songs are average and not good. Basrur disappoint this time. Songs from first part are better.(5/10)Although background score is good. (9/10)6. Editing: Could be more better and it is not smooth as chapter 1. (6/10)Hence overall rating is 7/10 and chapter 2 is disappoinment w.r.t first chapter. Still it is shining star of kanada and indian film industry.

This movie is watchable but we had too much expectations for this movie and it had gave us too much interest to watch as per trailer. Yash and Sanjay dutt both have acted very nicey in this movie as per their role.But there is too much loud music in background in this movie continuously till beginning to end of the movie.There is lot of mistakes in storyline in which Rokey is threatening to PM ramika sen and Indian force couldn't stop him. This is disgrace of our Indian force or security of PM.When Rockey's men attacked to adhira, only adhira has survived. And after leaving adhira, he had gain another army. There is too much insult of Physics.And no one's mother will tell you to become thief.Although this is a movie which is only for entertainment, so enjoy it.

This is one of the most awaited movie and it didn't fail to satisfy us. It's not just a movie with fights and shooting and violence. It's a movie with a good story, moral values, mother love, romance, sentimental scenes and many more. Also, the musical work is awesome! I would give 10/10.

But the core of the film, the story, is missing. The plot is utterly nonsensical and pointless and not grounded in any manner. The two and a half hours spent watching the film felt like an eternity. Movies are in a different league and KGF chapter 2 doesn't even revolve around the same standards. And definitely this movie is definitely overrated for no reason.

This is the most powerpack fim in Indian Cinema . Action, BGM , Screenplay , Direction are outstanding . Salute to the captain of this movie director Neel whose vision behind this and build this imaginary kingdom . Respect and salute to the Editor who is very young and did amazing work in this movie as such young age . Ravi Basrur is the Music Director who gave so much life with beautiful BGM and songs . I really enjoyed of this movie BGM . I heard so many hollywood type BGM ,but for first time I watched terrific kind of BGM in Indian Cinema .Last but not least our Hero Yash . No words for him he is really Rocking Star . Sanjay Sir as Adheera and Raveen ji as Ramika Sen were beautiful character in this movie .

Kgf2 is a true action thriller where protagonist shines through out his ups and downs in the movie . Yash and Sanjay Dutt make a perfect combo of rivals defending and attacking each other. Ticks of all the departments for a perfect action movie, be it acting , direction , screenplay or music everything was top notch.Only con I would say the background music sometimes during the movie is too loud which overshadowed the dialogues and exchange between the actors.

This film is gotta be the best movies in India .But the vfx of this film needs to be improved . This film shows exaggeration a lot which is quite common among films . The film's story is great . In my point of view of this movie , Movie is one time watch .

Due to its Chapter1 we all are eagerly waiting for chapter2. Storyline is not good. This movie shows that the Hero is a villain and the movie is an story war between villain. This movie is not a good moral film.

Credit to Prashanth Neel and Vijay Kirgandur for dreaming so big and executing such a massive dream; nearly every frame has multiple characters who never
looked crowded or forced in ;It's a very difficult movie to make and they have made it well.The cinematography is top notch ; this man will go placesYash lights up the screen ; his dialogues feel out of place every now and then-it dilutes the intensity especially his Intro scene :( but his swag and style make up for whatever rubbish lines he says sometimes)Srinidhi Shetty deserved much meatier role for her commitment to the movieSanjay Dutt screams a bit more than necessaryRaveena Tandon is a find and she nails itGreatest loss in the movie-
Anant nag is sorely missed - whatever reason may be, Prakash Rai's substitution does not do justice to the movie: ANANT Ingalagi's narration lifted the movie; you can't help but imagine Anant nag in place of Prakash Rai every time he narrates and end up feeling disappointed .Malavika gets monotonous and repetitive after sometime .Towards the end I stopped rooting for the mother- I felt she was eventually responsible for her son becoming a criminal - to become rich at every expenseHaving said so many negatives, still I vouch for the entire team's commitment to Make such a brave attempt; you need a large heart to do such a movie- I saw and felt similar efforts in Avane Srimannarayana and am glad this movie is doing well - Happy days for kannada cinemaPlease watch the movie inspite of all its flaws ( I am nit picking like a purist ); I enjoyed it but could not find a character I wanted to root for like KGF chapter 1.

Blowing up Police Station and Mocking Police is not what i liked.We respect Police and this is not what looks heroic !Yash presence is amazing though.Sanjay Dutt is ok ok.Ravina Tandon is PowerPacked.Prakash Raj is Boring and somebody else could have done it better.Aaj Tak Life mein itne Suite nahi dekhe jitne yash badalta hain😀 Shaadi Season On.Overall Okay Okay Movie.... Too Much of Unnecessary Violence.

RRR seemed under cooked in some parts and certainly over cooked for most of the film, but this KGF Chapter 2 is certainly a masterpiece. Astonishing!

reviews.review_title: Revolution of the South Film Industry
reviews.content: The saga of south films like KGF, Pushpa and RRR, has been like karpet bombing of the south towards the beginning of bollywood. Bollywood acted as a corporate mafia, promoting nepotism and worst films. I salute the south movies for avenging Sushanta Singh Rajput also.

reviews.review_title: A movie and lots of BGM
reviews.content: A typical south Indian movie with lots of action, lots of entires, lots of BGM and lots of slow motion. Indeed KGF 2 set a bench mark by giving an awesome sequel. Lots of hype though. A story line bit similar like other south movies, but then Yash, his beard, and his hair handled the movie leaving us goosebumps.

reviews.review_title: One of the best sequel by the indian movie
reviews.content: KGF-2 is the best sequel by an indian movie so far. If you like KGF-1 for its loud music , dialogue and all than KGF-2 wont disappoint you in that department. Yash was bad in KGF-1 than he is badass in KGF-2 and great movie to watch.

reviews.review_title: Huge hooting, green screenplay but still falls short
reviews.content: The movie is a direct intended sequel. It is not forced upon.Every story promised in the 1st part is revealed.But still the movie feels way too long. There are amazing screen moments where you want Rocky to smash everyone or you are just awaiting the twist shot, but still the movie feels a little forced in the 2nd half.The blacking out of the screen in car chase seems very jarring. 2 of 3 blackouts would have sufficed. The 10-12 blackouts take away the best of the scene. The same is applied at other points too and wears the audience down.The end races a bit to show where Rocky landed. Especially after the exit of Adheera. That is when the movie starts to test the patience.In total, it's great, has all over the top elements and is flamboyant, but still, feels a little too long, since as an Audience, we wanted it to end on a high note.

They made two movies into one... chapter 2 has many stories, they should have made two movies... screenplay is taken very fast, due to which you disconnect with the character, music is too loud sometimes due to which you cannot figure out the dialogues,... "Hindi viewers, please don't regret later on when it'll be playing on TV and internet." This is what I mentioned in my review of KGF Chapter 1 after I watched it in cinemas. And today, as I witnessed the second chapter of this epic action saga in cinemas as well, I found myself blown away by the gripping plot, gorgeous visuals, stunning action sequences and most importantly, Yash's screen presence as Rocky. I can safely proceed to state that my expectations were not only met, but also surpassed by this fine sequel.KGF Chapter 2 expands the scale and story introduced to us in part 1 and ends up raising the bar higher. The makers were definitely quite confident making it, and it shows in every single frame. From beautifully picturizing the KGF (Kolar Gold Fields) to explosively choreographing the action sequences to elevating Rocky's character at multiple occasions, they have shown they knew what the viewers wanted, and delivered the promise product without any hassle. I was also glad to see heavy cheering and whistling throughout almost the entire duration, and some credit goes to the dialogue writer as well. The music was also good and delivered without interfering with the storytelling (though one song in the second half wasn't really necessary).The biggest plus point of the film is its screenplay. From re-introducing our favorite characters and introducing new ones to building up conflicts and backing them with explosive action, KGF Chapter 2 has all the ingredients of a proper mass entertainer. Not a single scene where it feels dragged or overdone. Sure, it does feel long at times, but it never gets boring, and with several twists and turns, the story remains intriguing till the end.One thing I'd definitely want to tell the viewers is to not simply get up and walk away once the credits start rolling. There is a mid-credits scene, and it's an important one. Other than that, this film should be on your watchlist if you like period action films. In the end, I just feel glad and kind of proud seeing a film I liked in 2018 going on to receive much bigger hype and viewer turnout with its second part in 2022.

reviews.review_title: How about a story on the actual KGF?
reviews.content: As a fictious movie, it's fine. But the problem with Indian cinema (actually it's a problem with the audience) is that all they want is masala. Nobody touches the important points. They want to see the "hero" in the movie fixing all the problems, but in real life nobody even acknowledges the problems - and if you don't admit/acknowledge the problem then how do you expect a hero to come and solve it?Take for example - the actual KGF mines. As per the papers, it is not operational because of "environmental concerns". But let me ask you a question - does any country or company cares for environment if they actually find a gold mine? Forget gold - In India there are illegal mines for much cheaper things like coal and soil. Do you really think they would stop mining gold?With this movie, at least try to see what is actually happening behind the closed mines of KGFs. Is it actually closed, or is someone's illegally mining over there?

reviews.review_title: One of the best films ever!
reviews.content: A true masterpiece. This movie is a testament to the skill and determination of the Kannada creative industry.Made possible by the entire production crew under the helm of the showstopping director Prashanth, and the face and determination of a storm - Toofan, lovingly referred to as Rocking Star Yash.The story or should I say masterpiece? Is about how a mother's love and unwavering courage manifests in her child and transcends his being, fueling him set off to get that one thing he desires to own.. the world.Filmmaking, sound design, set design, screenplay, dialogues, art direction, direction, acting, casting etc. All of the above have been mastered by everyone that worked on this film & series.Definitely watchable multiple times, and each time you watch it new secrets unravel and you are left appreciating the film more and more.

This is a winner in many departments including direction, cinematography, editing, Background music, songs, acting, dialogues and VFX.When a story grows so big, so unrealistic and still win, its flaws are acceptable even with a 10 star rating. This movie falls short only in very few places and is overcompensated by some of the most powerful scenes.10/10 a winner.
A must watch to all movie goers except for those who don't like loud music.People of karnataka were waiting for this movie to take off since more than 3 years and it's totally worth the wait.

If KGF is going to be remembered for anything 100 years from now, it will be for the work of Ravi Basrur and Bhuvan Gowda. The background score and cinematography are better than those of every other Indian movie and are integral parts of what make it so impactful with the masses.Coming to acting,
Yash has been superb, his broken English is really fun. It is rare to see method acting in a massy movie so what Yash has done here is unique, he just lived through Rocky and not many people might be knowing that he has written his own dialogues in this. Also, credits to Sachin Gole for being the voice of Rocky in the Hindi version.Sanjay Dutt as Adheera has that frightening presence on the screen, his Vikings look, the fear he has among the people in KGF makes for a perfect antagonist to counter Rocky. He has changed his voice to deliver the dialogues which again makes his character more impactful.The costume designers have to be appreciated for the look of the 2 most important characters which increases their effect tenfold on the screen.Raveena Tandon as the authoritarian Prime Minister Ramika Sen has more of a grounded approach,with only the dialogue-delivery to show her acting prowess, which was much necessary because 2 other main characters have those larger than life roles. Having played the romantic interest to hero all her life, for the first time she got a character with substance and did more than enough to leave a lasting impression.Action scenes were a bit below expectations... mainly that car chase was very poorly executed. They went for frequent blackouts with editing and not for a long shot which looks natural and is pleasing to the eyes. Similarly in the last fight of Rocky-Adheera, they have focussed more on the hits and punches rather than making it look natural with a continuous take.But this scene of Kalashnikov stood out above all others and will be in my mind for a long time. Its setting, followed by the violence dialogue from Rocky made it a sequence you would pay for.The love story was cringey and problematic, and absence of Reena's character would not have made a difference to the otherwise gripping storyline.You will find people absolutely hating this movie, mainly here on Quora, and calling it a brainless mass entertainer even without watching it but with Prashant Neel at the helm of affairs, KGF is far from being something like that. You find good use of foreshadowing and symbolism assisting the storyline which massy movies usually don't have. Even props like Rocky's hammer, Adheera's sword, the caution board come into play in narrating the past or showcasing the victory of a character. The reaction takes with extras have an important part in helping us connect with the emotions of the people inside the screen, something Rajamouli used to good effect in Bahubali. In addition to that,
The set pieces used in Rocky and Adheera's entry scene, the play depicting events of Chapter 1 in the song Toofan, the Kali Puja in the song Sulthan look marvellous.The dark sepia tone perfectly suits the crime world of 70s-80s, the movie is set in.When we compare it with movies like Bahubali or RRR we need to understand that the makers of KGF are quite inexperienced, i.e., Prashant Neel had directed just one movie before KGF and hardly anybody outside Karnataka knew about Yash before it... There were very high expectations with the sequel as well so the audience could have easily got disappointed but even after approaching this large audience, getting massive succes in Chapter 1, Neel stayed true to his filmography and came out with flying colours.Rating: 8/10.

Right through K. G. F: Chapter 2, I couldn't help but imagine what it must have been like for Prashant Neel to watch The Godfather for the first time. More than the whole film, I'd love to ask him someday about the impact its climax left him with as he watched it in what I imagine to be an old theatre, wherever he grew up. Like the iconic theatre scene in Cinema Paradiso, this moment must have been Prashanth's big life-altering moment, his metamorphosis where he not only discovered the magic of movies but also the concept of "mass" before it became a thing. Without sounding too dramatic, something must have clicked in him because there's no one here who thinks in intercuts like this man.

KGF - CHAPTER 2 Hindi is the story of a man who faces new challenges after successfully taking over an empire. Rocky kills Garuda (Ramachandra Raju) in the Kolar Gold Fields, aka, KGF, and takes charge, much to the annoyance of Guru Pandian (Achyuth Kumar), Andrews (B S Avinash), Rajendra Desai (Lakki Lakshman). They had expected to rule KGF and take over its immense wealth. However, Rocky, with the help of the slaves who consider him a messiah, usurps the throne. He even kills Virat (Vinay Bidappa), brother of Garuda and the heir apparent to the KGF throne. Rocky however spares Vanaram (Ayyappa P Sharma), the commander of the army at KGF. Vanaram, angry at first, joins Rocky and trains young kids who become the new guards of the territory. Rocky discovers that there are several unexcavated mines in the area and he orders the men to start extracting gold from these places. The idea is to discover as much gold as possible in the shortest possible time. Meanwhile, Adheera (Sanjay Dutt), brother of Suryavardhan, the founder of KGF, was presumed dead. However, he is alive and arrives at KGF for revenge and to claim ownership. He smartly gets Rocky out of KGF and shoots him. He allows Rocky to survive so that the word is spread in KGF that the terrifying Adheera is here. Rocky recuperates but realizes that no one is able to move out of KGF as Adheera's men have surrounded the mines. Meanwhile, Shetty (Dinesh Mangaluru), Rocky's ex-boss in Bombay, has tied up with fellow gangsters across West and South India, and plans to act against Rocky. They are also dealing with Inayat Khalil (Balakrishna), a dreaded gangster from Dubai. How Rocky fights all these elements forms the rest of the film. Prashanth Neel's story is excellent and pays a nice tribute to the angry-young-man and gangster films of Amitabh Bachchan of the 70s and 80s. Prashanth Neel's screenplay is highly captivating. Despite such a vast storyline and so many characters, his writing flows smoothly. Also, he is aware that audiences expect a lot of massy stuff from KGF - CHAPTER and in this regard, he makes fans very happy as he has peppered the narrative with plenty of clapworthy scenes. The Hindi dialogues are very powerful and further enhance the commercial appeal of the film. A few scenes work big time just due to the acidic one-liners..

reviews.review_title: K.G.F Chapter 2, Masterpiece Of Indian Cinema.
reviews.content:
K. G. F : Chapter 2 review : Stunning Action Packed Drama.My rating : 5/5
Performances :
Yash is just outstanding with his terrific performance and unleashes his amazing screen presence throughout the movie. Yash continued from where he left in KGF 1. He carried himself with the same intensity and energy. He looked stylish, raw, and rugged and costumes suited his swag and mannerisms. He showed variations in his expressions turning brutal, ruthless, and menacing at one time and humane, and emotional at other times.Srinidhi Shetty got a limited screen presence just like her role in the first part. However, she did full justice to her emoting well.Sanjay Dutt looked powerful evoking fear as Adheera. Though the scenes featuring Yash and Sanjay Dutt are powerfully written, Sanjay Dutt's age showed up on the screen bringing down the intensity levels.Raveena Tandon looked intense as a powerful politician who meant business while dealing with the anti-social elements.Rao Ramesh as the CBI officer performed well and Prakash Raj did justice to her role.Technical values :
Prashant Neel drove everyone crazy with the hero elevation with mass elements in KGF1 which turned him into a national celebrity. All eyes are on him as to how he will come up in the KGF2. Prashant Neel dispelled all the doubts right from the start to the finish. He filled the entire film with heavy-duty action scenes which knocked the living daylights out of the viewers. The standout stunts included Yash's introduction, the action sequence before the interval and scenes that come up after the interval, and the heavy-duty climax. The stunt choreography is sensational. In order to elevate the heroism of Yash, he even showed Sanjay Dutt in an even more powerful manner. The way he ends the character of Rocky is also impressive. KGF 2 has so many factors that will relate to the masses as Neel takes us to the world of KGF and entertains you completely.Music by Ravi Basrur is a backbone for the film as the re-recording breathes life to the film and all the elevation scenes on Rocky. Audio-wise, the film has all situational songs and is passable on screen.Bhuvan Gowda's cinematography is top-notch as he presented the film superbly with his framing. The lighting setup created to showcase the dark shades in the movie is impressive.Anbariv action choreography is Marvelous.Dialogues are intense and production values are grand.Highlights :
Yash Excellent performance
Elevations of Heroism
Terrific Action Stunts
Cinematography and Bgm
Rich production valuesOverall : Terrific Monster.488 people found this helpful.
