reviews.review_title: A masterpiece of 3I's - Indelible, Incredible, Immense
reviews.content: The much awaited sequel of KGF-1 is absolutely worth the wait (of 2 long years). The plot, flow, sequence, cinematography, action and everything was on point and subtle to the core. Rocky's role couldn't have been played by any other actor. He's the man who's made for it - The One and Only Masterpiece❤🔥! The eternal bond between Rocky and Reena, their purest form of love and her audacity are mind-boggling and heartwarming. His mother's name was finally revealed in this chapter. Her puissant relation with Rocky, her words had an immense effect on his life, right from the beginning. In fact, it was truly she who kept him going and combat all his ferocious and heinous combatants who had constantly been backstabbing him. The new roles introduced in this chapter have a big say and the climax made me speechless. But I'm glad about the closing theme giving us a surprise too. The hype created is absolutely worth it! Overall, it is certainly the #PrideOfKarnataka in every way. A fantastic present to the film industry by our Sandalwood. Prashant Neel sir has aced it✨💥! #ProudKannadathi & #ProudFanGirlOFYash❤💥

DIRECTOR PRASHANT NEEL HAS CREATED THE FILM ON NEXT LEVEL & LAST BUT NOT THE LEAST BACKGROUND MUSIC, SONGS OF THIS FILM IS THE MAIN THING TO BE THE SUPER BLOCKBUSTER EVER.P. S. I can safely proceed to state that my expectations were not only met, but also surpassed by this fine sequel.This will go down as the greatest Indian films ever, Storyline was more sublime than ever Grand performance from Yash, bit illogical fights but yes anything comes under fiction and if you're getting a story like this then nothing comes close KGF 2 - surely A MASTERPIECE.

What a great movie..🔥
Next lvl movie exprience.....great job🥂💪🔥A decade ago, the Kannada film industry was striving hard to make quality films to join the race with other South Indian films for a Pan India recognition. People who follow KGF from Part 1 have a huge expectation for this sequel and Director didn't disappoint the fans in Chapter 2. Quite a lot of detailing went into the script to bring out the true essence of KGF from Chapter one.Prashanth Neel will surely join the list of top directors in India. He deserves all praise and applause for his great work in the film. The storyline is quite simple but the way it was written and narrated makes the film stand out from other commercial films. The inclusion of Adheera and Ramika Sen adds value to the script.In my opinion, KGF Chapter 2 is one of the best commercial films made in Non-Linear format. The film travels back and forth with some interesting twists and turns to unfold the remaining story. Prasanth Neel outlined and sketched all the vital characters with a purpose. The theme of KGF is to glorify the heroic acts of Rocky Bhai but at the same time, each build-up sequence is carefully coined with emotional value. The audience erupts in theatres for all game-changing moments.Yash again proves that he is the best in business to perform a powerful role like Rocky. His screen presence with a rugged beard look and fearless attitude is precise for the build-up scenes. The introduction scene of Rocky in Chapter 2 is a treat to watch. The climax encounter with Adheera gives an adrenaline rush to the audience. There are quite a lot of goosebumps moments in the film and the best among all is the Police Station gunshot scene.Srinidhi Shetty plays a less impactful female lead but towards the end, she performed well to an extent. Sanjay Dutta as Adheera gets a stunning introduction but his role was sidelined in the middle portion of the film as Raveena share the screen as Ramika Sen. All the supporting characters are connected well in the plot. Prakash Raj takes the role of Anant Nag as narrator but it was not engaging as it was in Chapter one.

Just awesome. The experience of this magnum opus can not be described in words, it can only be felt! The Acting is superb by all the veterans, the direction is masterclass (at the beginning of his career, Prashanth is giving such amazing movies, then we can't imagine how he is going to create history in future!), Cinematography is excellent and Story, oh my God, that's just amazing! I think Bollywood's supremacy is going to be over completely soon for sure! And yeah, that's good for indian cinema, considering the nepotism and other similar factors! Regional directors are doing master work! We should encourage them to do more like this by watching such worthy stuff, instead of wasting our money in lallu-pallu scrap...

reviews.review_title: One of the greatest and finest sequel Indian film fans from whole over the word ever see.
reviews.content: KGF 2 is the best Indian film I have watched this year. Every aspect of this film was giving me goosebumps moments , from the cinematography which presented the in a grade A manner, action sequences which pushes the audience to the edge of the seat, CGI which pins Rocky's KGF city into everyone's mind, the screenplay which never once gave the of feel lag throughout the long duration of the movie, the editing which was on point and BGM the flare to whole of the film. Prashanth Neel and Yash have handled the movie like the precious gold of KGF itself. Not just Yash but every characters played their part in this film disregarding the recurring or new faces in the film, especially Sanjay Dutt and Raveena Tandon whose character came with high expectations. Since I watched the film in tamil, hats off to dialogue writer for the memorable line. KGF 2 clearly one of the best Kannada movies. Its clearly a 10/10 film.

reviews.review_title: Disappointed by the story but cinematography was great
reviews.content: I was thinking that I would rate this movie 10/10 but after watching it, I was disappointed by the story. In my view, KGF Chapter 2 could not meet my expectations which was set high by KGF Chapter 1.The Chapter 1 was filled with too much stories compacted in short period of time. It had got war, power, politics, diplomacy, emotions and everything else to make a movie great. But the Chapter 2 is unable to include everything in a balanced way. No doubt that there are great fight scenes with some rare cinematography ever witnessed in indian cinema. But story wise, it is too weak.The character development isn't also in par with KGF Chapter 1. The portrayal of villainous characters are so weak that they only seem strong in their getup and armor. There is no diplomatic play between the characters. Sanjay Dutt as Adheera looks dangerous but the movie portrayed him in a weak way. There's no mind game. They just fight and and the only stronger wins. Other villains like Rajendar Desai, Shetty and Andrew who were portrayed great in Chapter 1 died of nothing. Also Adheera isn't someone who was shown to be like a diplomatic and strong character. Disappointed.This movie is great if you are a fan of Yash and someone who likes fights, guns, slow motions, styles and cinematography. But other than that everything seems forced inside a movie to grab the attention of the audience (which failed in my case). The movie could have been great and better that Chapter 1.Maybe the writer was unable to discern what made people like KGF Chapter 1. I will not go the theatre to watch the Chapter 3 with such weak story.

reviews.review_title: There was a surprise in every next scene of movie
reviews.content: Specially thanks to whole K. G. F team. My opinions about K. G. F chapter 2 are - 1) Best ever entry scene that audience were excited about. 2) Rocking star Yash's dialogues are so soul touching because his dialogues can used everywhere. 3) Each and every character fit in his/her role. 4) Never seen before Sanjay dutt look and performance even same for Raveena Tandon. 5) Srinidhi Shetty, she is a latest crush for everyone. 6) Music and Songs gives us goosebumps. 7) Everybody wanted that movie shouldn't have any end. 8) Everybody eagerly waiting for 3rd chapter like me. 9) That struggling Yash(Rocky) is so motivational for every youth. 10) Hats off to the director and producer.

All I love is Ricky's acting & story & cymetrography. The movie direction is s superb. & it.this movie turned out to be great. It's a story narrated over continuously overlapping action visuals. I should say that the direction, camerawork and editing is excellent. It is on par with 300 and Sin City. The whole direction and medium used to narrate the story is superb and flows smoothly. Usually I get headaches in action movies, but this was well integrated without overpowering you. Its a must watch in a theater. The visuals on a big screen are great. If you understand the origin language - Kannada, you will enjoy the literary dialogue better, but subtitles are fair enough. When I first encountered the trailer I started comparing it with Gangs of Wasseypur. The reason was there it was story started with coal mines and here Gold mines were mentioned. After watching the movie however I got to know K. G. F. To be a kind of different movie. A movie based on a hero (or a villain). The story is a classic portrayal of waging wars against their oppressors. Few scenes made me draw comparisons to Aayirathil Oruvan & Mad Max Fury Road. The BGM along with the freeze frame action sequences worked out well.

Neither such a film was made, nor will it ever be made, (both parts) What should I say, if you talk about rating, then 1 point out of 10 is not there to reduce. The story and direction are so tight that you can't even blink and There are so many twists and turns in the story that you cannot imagine. Where the first part of the story ended, the second part takes it to the top. It is very difficult to take the story of any film to another part and above, but the director has done wonders.When it came to acting, Yash broke all limits in playing the role of a gangster. His style of walking, sitting style, manner of talking, body language and his fight scenes have immortalized him in the role of gangster. Sanjay Dutt looked great in the character of the villain. Rest of the actors have done their respective roles. The cinematography is at the level of the best films in the world. The background music has brought life to every scene of the film. After years, such background music has been heard.To be honest, I have no words to praise this film. Just this film forced me to write. Please do watch this movie.

reviews.review_title: Cinematography, Slow-mo, Loud BGM, and Crappy Gold Fields
reviews.content: Q. What do characters do most of the time in the movie?A. Watch Rocky Bhai walk around in slow motion on loud background music.Q. What does Sanjay Dutt's Viking avatar do?A. Tries to imitate Rocky bhai from Answer 1 but fails, manages to dodge every single bullet just by standing his ground, crib and make a complete a** of himselfQ. What is the actress paid for ?A. Not speaking.Q. Raveena Tandon's role?A. Female pseudo Rocky Bhai, without slow-mo, and with political power.Q. Did you find the length suitable?A. It would have been better, had Rocky bhai not decided to walk so much in the movie, and wait for eternity before delivering punchlinesQ. Anything good in about the movie?A. Cinematography.Q. Best sequence/scene ?A. Mad Max like chase sequence, marred by very intermittent screen blackouts.Q. Anything stupid in the movie?A. Practically everything.Q. Do I want to vent out?A. Yes, but trying to find creative ways of doing it.Q. But people are calling it a masterpiece ?A. They are blindsided by the grandeur.Q. What about numbers it has attained?A. The producers should use the same to take courses on good cinema, watch Mubi, and understand the importance of good writing.Q. Any advise to people who have not watched the movie?A. Read books.

reviews.review_title: Best South Indian movie I've ever seen
reviews.content:
Daily reminder KGF was 💥🔥🔥Epitome of all Masterpieces. Greatest of all time. Zenith of the medium. Hallmark of media. Gold standard of storytelling. Apogee of creativity. Vertex of invention. Crest of ingenuity. Acme of imagination. Pinnacle of innovation. Epic of epics. Legend among legends. Peak fictionCan't forget
one above all , peak creation , lonely at the summit,goats above goats, grandiose masterpiece, impeccable perfection, too exquisite to exist, unbelievably marvelous creation, spectacularly bewildering and stupendous imagination,work of god.Groundbreaking and foundational, his sense of development is a deconstruction of employment segregation and the powerful performances are truly comprehensive of their poignant themes while the nuance in the direction complements a layered screenplay.Pure elegant, exquisite, endeavour. I can't put my finger on what's wrong because there isn't anything, masterful character-making from a masterful person. Top of the decade. Top of the century. Top of my life, it's all downhill now.
Didn't expect that much from it. For me this is the finest action movie that India have ever made. The starting was good but the ending was mind-blowing.

Its a wonderfully crafted fictional Mass entertainer. These words would explain the whole movie altogether.There are two types of movie audience type and critic type. I'm a type of person who loves critic type of movie. But this one here clearly belongs audience and I loved it. I would like to appreciate the director for tricking me to forget abt logic and convinced me to enjoy the Movie irrespective of the flaws it has got. The narrative, Visuals, background score, writing of screenplay are the huge plus factor. He has given more importance to the writing. Screenplay is so engaging that you will have no time to think abt all those logics. Backed by constant BGM and Wonderful cinematography. (they never let their director down throughout movie)
I understand if a critic gives less ratings, but you can't deny the fact that adrenaline rush your body went through while watching this movie. I know its not a perfect movie but I love the way it made me feel.

My first and last review in this lifetime...
On 13 th I came from office ..watched IPL till 11:00.Then started watching KGF -1 again..
I woke up and avoided looking at phone notification or browse through chrome and you tube as I didnt want any information regarding KGF-2 to reach me ... Next day I went for KGF-2.I reached theater 30 mins before movie time ...These 30 min were very Hard...I wanted to break open the Entrance and wanted the movie to start at the earliest...
Once the movie started I sat like I was giving an exam and nothing goes unnoticed on the screen...
Concentarion level during movie was beyond imagination...
And then came Rocking * Yash ...Once in your life time Movies like KGF are made..N througout your life you wont stop prasing the movie..That is KGF for me....

reviews.review_title: power-packed commercial film but went downhill for not focusing the story
reviews.content: KGF-2 is a completely power-packed commercial film, comparatively better in sense of storytelling, with a good start. If you can put all your rationality aside and be ready to watch a 168 minutes trailer, then you really gonna enjoy it.I liked its prior part for its unique story which tells the story of the people living under slavery and as a commercial, it was important to visualize something that the mass can engage with. And the story and characters circling around the protagonist are common. But when every single move or incident is happening no matter what and dumping random scenes and villains just to prove Yash hyper SWAG is totally useless exaggeration.1)a stretched ending, 2) repetitive scenes, 3)some hilarious fight sequences which were ridiculously long, 4)avoidable plot holes, 5)poor visual effects- overall I didn't enjoy it that much. Sanjay Dutt did not justify the character at all. The car chase sequence was worst edited. The way it was shot, in a start-stop manner, didn't like. The movie was made to be thrilling but believe me, it's absolutely inappropriate in a political context, I would rather watch and enjoy the same type of story in a Viking movie where the fight is the main essence. The movie was made to portray an invincible human without any logical superpower except for blessings from his mother and absolute luck and some motivation from 20years back. The story went downhill for proving Yash the monster or Savior or whatever you say rather than not focusing on the story.Now please don't ask about the Kabir Singh Hyper masculinity effect in this movie, rather just wonder about why Ganesh Gaithonde didn't have muscle like Rocky bhai.

Best movie ever. In 2018, the blockbuster film KGF: Chapter 1 got released. Chapter 2 is the sequel to it. Vijay Kiragandur under the banner Hombale Films produces the film, directed by Prashanth Neel. Rockstars Yash, Srinidhi Shetty, Sanjay Dutt, and Raveena Tandon play the leads, while Prakash Raj, Malavika Avinash, Eswari Rao, and others provide supporting roles. Ravi Basrur composed the music, and Bhuvan Gowda handled the cinematography.This installment of the series continues where the previous episode left off, with Rocky (Yash) as the leader of the KGF. Sanjay Dutt's character Adheera (Sanjay Dutt), who was believed to be dead, wants to take over the Gold Field. Rocky's allies from the first part have become his enemies, and they have also set their eyes on the throne. Ramika Sen, India's Prime Minister, has also declared Rocky the nation's most wanted criminal, and he is pursued by police. Whether Rocky maintains control over KGF and how he handles all these issues forms the plot of the film.

reviews.review_title: Ignore the movie a a fiction, imagine a movie where you have the balls to do what's you dreamt to do
reviews.content: Loads of points in the movie are far fetched, loads of points are unrealistic. But imagine a person within the current society who doesn't give a sh**. He has goal though unrealistic, but the one was set up by his poor dying mother. This movie is about going through things to achieve these pre-destined Goliaths. The protagonist though unreal resembles a multiverse where a common pneumoniac kid destined to die, can grow up to be an inhuman but still bleed driven by a weakness( his humane side )which propels him to save some if not all. Loads of review online discuss about an over the top story, and I agree but my question to them is, why do you watch a movie? To forget your present, sometimes to remember the past, and sometimes to look for the future. Why can't there be a movie which talks about a resembling past (the ravina tondon performance did remind me of our own Iron Lady with all her shortcomings), a motivation less covid stricken present (where every one is confined to their own dark deep mines) and a selfless future (where your being is in commensalism with others). But just forget about all my bull sh**, watch the movie with a lovely sound track, on a Dolby sound, forget about the in-consequentialness of life, and remember the incapabilities of a father to create another Rocky (pun intended). You will get it when you watch the first half. Thanks.

Now as you are praising the editing and the dope visuals you might think the budget became huge... in fact for an Indian film the budget is big, not huge. The budget of KGF chapter 1 was approx. US$ 10.6 million, but for the chapter 2 it is just 25% of increase from prequel's budget, i.e., approx. US$ 13.3 million, which is a very low budget for any Hollywood film to make a KGF range of film.With that much budget also to make such an impactful and visual spectacle film... can be done only out of an maverick vision and hardcore passion and determination.

Prashanth Neel's KGF !!🔥
One movie, a lot of housefull shows in the theater, full of noises, cheers and applauses, a scenario that celebrates a kannada movie all over Kerala. Today after the morning 11am house full show, I got the best theater experience of my life. A view that celebrates a movie by the whole generation without the language barriers.KGF : Today, it is a brand. A brand that no one in Indian cinema history can break.🙌🏻When it comes to cinema, every aspect of this movie is awesome. Acting, Vfx, Editing, Music, Action, Direction, Story, Screenplay, Performances are all mindblowing to each other. When 'Yash' scored with the character of 'Rocky Bhai', the character came to mind in such a way that we could not even imagine anyone other than him. Sanjay Dutt's 'Adheera', Raveena Tandon's 'Ramika Sen' and Srinidhi Shetty's 'Reena' deserve applause. But the most favourite character was Rocky's Mother ( Shanthama) played by 'Archana Jois'.👌
All the songs and their placement was lit. Especially 'Thoofan', the song itself gavs goosebumps. All the characters who was given enough space and delivers good performances. The children and their Mass scenes are enough to make the entire crowd to whistle for.Prashanth Neel - The Pioneer Filmmaker, I don't know how to praise him. Of course, he is an asset to Indian cinema. Making a film like this with a limited budget of 100cr without any compromise to its quality is something that a very professional and hardworking filmmaker can do and will catch everybody's attention too."KGF is just a beginning, there is lot more to come from The Pioneer Filmmaker Prashanth Neel."💎In other words, the film that gave goosebumps in every scene and in every dialogue. The casting of the film itself is superb and the Making is at Top Notch level.💯Maybe, if you miss this film in theaters you can later watch it when it releases through OTT platforms like any other films.But once you watch this from theaters, you can witness the best ever theater experience of your life.🙏

KGF 2 Review: 'KGF:Chapter 1' set the tone for a slick gangster franchise-high on style and details. The first part was all about establishing the intentions and power of Raja Krishnappa Bairya aka Rocky Bhai. The second part has managed to create hype with its promotional content that gives a peek into the film. Does the film manage to match the build-up? It does and provides a better sequel and also has a big surprise for fans in the end, too.The film begins with Vijayendra Ingalagi, the son of Anand Ingalagi, taking over as the narrator. Rocky has won over the people of KGF and he is now in the process of dreaming bigger and treading more dangerous paths. In this process, he encounters Adheera, who is inspired by the Vikings and evokes visceral fear, who wants KGF back. Simultaneously, he also has to encounter the righteous Prime Minister Ramika Sen, who also wants Rocky taken down.

A prior thing i want to tell you before i write the review :I am a college student and a hostelier , i was having some work in college but i left that in mid just to come back home and watch this movie . My friends in college says South Indian movies is all about illogical action scenes , no story , i told them before leaving , we have already proved you with Bahubali and many more . I reached home & asked my friends from hometown to come with me for the movie , they showed no interest & urged me to watch Zero , fortunately the only theatre in my hometown is showing KGF movie . So , i went to watch it alone & it's better to go alone than going with friends & getting their negative words for the movie while watching .Analysis :Only one line for the movie " Once in millennia" From the screenplay to the dialogues , the movie was commendable .Before the intervalFirst half is full of action . The entry scene of Yash is amazing . Yash is doing role of character " Rocky" . The child actor has done his role at its best . In first half , lot of characters are introduced , you have to remember each and every actor as they have their role further in movie . The first half is story instigator with mind blowing action scenes . A small love story of Yash , and you know that any love story in South India is incomplete without action and same you will get here . In first half what i adored the most , the goosebump giving scene is the last scene before interval . I will not tell you what was that , just go and watch , and i hope you will love too ............................INTERVAL.......................Was too much hungry , as i skipped my breakfast and lunch to come to home from college and without taking any rest , i ran to watch the movie , so bought some chips , cold drink . After interval , some favourite ads of my friends again came.....................................................................The second halfThe real story began in the second part of movie. I personally like second half more than the first. The second half is what makes me the die hard fan of this movie. Again a lot of dialogues , that song showing mother love for her child Rocky completely caught attention. I am waiting for the movie songs to release especially that "Sultan" song. The tremendous work of Yash , his superb acting skills , all are beyond imagination. The terminating part of movie is unexpected and left curiousity in the minds of audience. I think the movie ended at a phenomenal stage, if you will not watch Chapter 2 that's also good , because the Chapter 1 despite leaving some suspense , can say it to be complete. But the story doesn't end here. The movie is elongated for the second chapter of the movie .For screenplay : 4.5/5For direction : 4/5For dialogues : 4/5Overall rating : 4/5Review for the movie : A Simple line " Going to watch this movie again "Yes , this movie put a smile on everyone's face and made everyone's day . As , I already said i love the CHAPTER 1 and second part perhaps not required but i also want this movie not to end here , eagerly waiting for the CHAPTER 2You can hate South Indian movies , but you can't ignore the emerging Yash and KGF . Zero movie is not running well , it's expected that KGF will get more screens , of Zero also .Edit : Some people are comparing Bahubali with KGF by saying KGF is not even near to position where Bahubali is but on being opposite to their reviews , I like KGF more than "Bahubali - The beginning " . It's truth that KGF will be criticized and people are criticizing it too. But what can we say, it's their views.EDIT 2 : Watched the movie for the second time , still same curiosity.

IRate : 10 out of 10 ( not a BLOCKBUSTER, a new term penned by me, It's a "R-O-O-F-B-U-S-T-E-R")Extraordinary scenes in Pune as well as even centre like Jamnagar, Surat, Ahemdabad where even 6am shows are Housefull (forget the madness in South)Well well well, India has got a new R-O-O-F-B-U-S-T-E-R STAR and his name is YASH. KGF Chapter 1 surprised us all by showing the world of KGF in second half. But here in Chapter 2, director Prashant Neel immerses us completely in the world of KGF and from there ROCKY Bhai Yash takes over & rides the journey with many twists and turns with his awesome style, Hollywood level action, Bold charisma, whistle-worthy dialogues, his hard hitting punches & punchlines, delivering a KING-SIZED ENTERTAINMENT !!KGF Chapter 2 is YASH's ticket to being a CROWD PULLING SUPERSTARDOM ! It's time to pack the bags for Bollywood's Khan's and Kumar's & Kapoor's because after Rajnikanth, this is YASH's time to be a legendary all-time favourite actor of pan-Indian audience for a long long timePositives : Yash, Yash and Yash. Apart from that, Sanjay Dutt stands out as a menacing villain in a gruesome avtaar and ofcourse, the comeback of Raveena Tandon in a powerful act.Stunning visuals, Heart-thumping background score, Fast paced screenplay and a suspenseful climax makes this a must watchNagetive : nothing.

The blood-soaked land of Kolar Gold Fields (KGF) has a new overlord now - Rocky, whose name strikes fear in the heart of his foes. His allies look up to Rocky as their savior, the government sees him as a threat to law and order; enemies are clamoring for revenge and conspiring for his downfall. Bloodier battles and darker days await as Rocky continues on his quest for unchallenged supremacy.

Yash is just outstanding with his terrific performance and unleashes his amazing screen presence throughout the movie. Yash continued from where he left in KGF 1. He carried himself with the same intensity and energy. He looked stylish, raw, and rugged and costumes suited his swag and mannerisms. He showed variations in his expressions turning brutal, ruthless, and menacing at one time and humane, and emotional at other times.Srinidhi Shetty got a limited screen presence just like her role in the first part. However, she did full justice to her emoting well.Sanjay Dutt looked powerful evoking fear as Adheera. Though the scenes featuring Yash and Sanjay Dutt are powerfully written, Sanjay Dutt's age showed up on the screen bringing down the intensity levels.Raveena Tandon looked intense as a powerful politician who meant business while dealing with the anti-social elements.Rao Ramesh as the CBI officer performed well and Prakash Raj did justice to her role.

Spoilers ahead...There is something outlandish yet gorgeous about the K. G. F franchise that they no longer make such films. That they no longer imagine scenes propelled by absolute madness. After all, K. G. F films are written on steroids.There is a moment in K. G. F: Chapter 2, where Rocky Bhai (a rocking Yash, bathed and cleansed in masculine orgy) takes a machine gun out to blow up a police station, in the garb of a "field test". With a cigarette hanging from his lip, he fires aimlessly to show his prowess as bullets zoom past the station and everything in between. Bullet casings drop to the ground and Bhai walks in slow-motion to light up his cigarette from the gun's nozzle with an equally electrifying background score by Ravi Basrur.
Fantastic job hole team of kgf ultimate movie go to theaters and see the movie yash performance was superr.. . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .

Spoilers ahead...There is something outlandish yet gorgeous about the K. G. F franchise that they no longer make such films. That they no longer imagine scenes propelled by absolute madness. After all, K. G. F films are written on steroids.There is a moment in K. G. F: Chapter 2, where Rocky Bhai (a rocking Yash, bathed and cleansed in masculine orgy) takes a machine gun out to blow up a police station, in the garb of a "field test". With a cigarette hanging from his lip, he fires aimlessly to show his prowess as bullets zoom past the station and everything in between. Bullet casings drop to the ground and Bhai walks in slow-motion to light up his cigarette from the gun's nozzle with an equally electrifying background score by Ravi Basrur.

The stars of KGF 2 are Yash and Prashanth Neel. The Kannada superstar's towering personality does full justice to the almost mythical character of Rocky Bhai. Very few stars would have made a role like Rocky Bhai believable and Yash owns it in every frame. Filmmaker Prashanth Neel ensures that the story proceeds at a brisk pace. Sanjay Dutt matches him in presence. Prakash Raj is nuanced as the narrator of the film. Raveena Tandon is impressive and you will wonder why she did not get such roles in her prime. From Rocky Bhai gaining sole control over Narachi to how he makes one quick escape to return stronger, it is one helluva ride. The visuals will linger in your memory for a long time. The team has shot at JSW sites, which gives KGF 2 the canvas of brown, grey and black. Ravi Basrur's scintillating BGM lifts up the sequences and you cannot help but stay transfixed to the screen. Another star of the film is cinematographer Bhuvan Gowda. The aesthetic of KGF 2 is a lot like Mad Max: Fury Road. Prashanth Neel who is part of the writing team ensures scenes loaded with dry humour and witty dialogues. With references to nepotism and secularism, KGF 2 taps into the modern milieu.

There are extraordinary action movies that India has recently witnessed which includes Bahubali and RRR.But....... The KGF franchise is on a whole other level!!! The movie KGF 2 completely lives up to the hype that's among the audience. It delivers a completely satisfying package of action, entertainment and drama. The Dialouges, the BGM, the cinematography; everything is just awesome. Some scenes can even be matched with hollywood action films.And of course, the story. The story is so well written and the screenplay is so good that keeps people engaged throughout the movie. Another plus point of this movie which makes it better than other action movies are the realistic elements. The story feels real, the action scenes are practical, the set pieces are real and so are the Emotions that this movie conveys. And this is the specialty of KGF.Hats off to the director - Prasanth Neel. I had never thought that such a mass movie could be made in India. Kudos to the entire kgf team.This will be my most fav action movie forever coz I don't really think that any movie can replace the hype that KGF has created.

The multiverse .....the rocky ......the KGF.Chapter 2 follows the story of Rocky (Yash), an orphan rising from poverty to become the king of a gold mine. The first film came out in 2018. In addition to Yash, the sequel features Bollywood actor Raveena Tandon and marks Sanjay Dutt's debut in Kannada films. KGF: Chapter 2 also stars Prakash Raj, Malavika Avinash, and Srinidhi Shetty, among others.About starring in the film, Srinidhi told PTI in an interview. "I couldn't believe I had received the opportunity. I was going for the homecoming ceremony (after the international pageant) and this was the first project I got. I went for the meeting, and Prashanth narrated the story and my character. Back then it was not 'KGF' part one and two," she added.

reviews.review_title: A milestone in history of Kannada film industry
reviews.content: First of all if you are a hater of Yash or hater of masala movie genre then I dont know why you are even reading reviews in IMDB for this movie. This movie is definitely not for you.Now for people who love ENTERTAINMENT at its purest form without restrictions, this movie is going to give you the best and only leave you hungry for more. I have seen many people complain about the jeeps jumping up when Yash shoots the chain gun (No Spoiler - Already shown in trailer) but think about it for a second, does it really matter when you are lost in the glory of the screenplay, the visuals and awesome BGM which accompanies it. Yash a.k.a Rocky's attitude, his style and way he delivers his dialogues are unmatchable. Most people again complain that movie is full of Build-up scenes/dialogues. But again none of it matters when thats what the mass audience actually paid for. Again for people complaining "how one person can kill so many" or question logic , I dont think we ever questioned Keanu in John Wick or Stallone in Rambo or Arnold in Commando... did we? I dont atleast want to be biased or be harsh on our own people.This certainly is not just a movie for us Kannadigas but a festival, a success we all like to celebrate whether we are fans of one actor or other. It really is a proud moment today that people all over India and the world are comparing Prashanth Neels work to the likes of S. S. Rajamouli's Baahubali.Whether you love him or hate him there is no denying the fact that Yash is the man because of whom Kannada movie industry has broken/set all kinds of records today and has taken our industry to the greatest heights.Arrreyyyy dont think too much yaar. Just go and enjoy the movie in your nearest cinema hall while it is still there.P. S. - For people who want to watch this movie - Please watch K. G. F 1 in Amazon Prime before watching this so that you can get the best experience of Chapter 2.

The plot of this film connects with its predecessor. For more information on the predecessor's plot, see K. G. F: Chapter 1.The night after detailing the events in K. G. F: Chapter 1, Anand Ingalagi suffers a stroke and his son Vijayendra takes over for K. G. F: Chapter 2. Rocky kills heir apparent Virat and takes charge as the kingpin of Kolar Gold Fields (K. G. F), keeping Reena hostage to ensure the cooperation of Guru Pandian, Andrews and Rajendra Desai, and kills Kamal when he protests. He issues orders to start work in eight hidden mines. Exasperated with K. G. F, some central ministers plan a no-confidence motion against the DYSS-supported government to bring Ramika Sen in power. Meanwhile, Adheera resurfaces and kills all guards at an outpost. In a ruse to bring Rocky outside K. G. F, Andrews kills Desai to lure Reena outside, and John captures Reena. Adheera shoots Rocky but spares his life, while his men roadblock all gold exports from K. G. F.Meanwhile, Shetty ties up with other subordinates of Andrews across the Western Coast and exterminates Rocky's allies. A recuperated Rocky along with Reena visits Dubai to deal in gold with Inayat Khalil, but Khalil had joined forces with Shetty. Rocky's aides kill Shetty's associates and recaptures the Western Coast, and Khalil deals with Rocky and sells him AK-47s. Rocky and his gang gravely wound Adheera and kill his henchmen with their newly acquired weapons. Meanwhile, Rocky's henchmen threaten the ministers against the vote and the no-confidence motion fails. Rocky kills Shetty, gaining control over Bombay. Pandian warns Rocky of Sen's rising stature but he disregards him. Reena develops feelings for Rocky.Three years later in 1981, Ramika Sen wins the Indian general elections and becomes Prime Minister. After CBI officer Kanneganti Raghavan briefs her about the situation in K. G. F, she closes all state borders and authorises him to raid Rocky's warehouses. A young Ingalagi is caught spying by Rocky's henchmen, but Rocky is impressed by his integrity. The CBI find nothing in their raids save for a 400 gram-gold bar. Rocky retrieves it from a police station and singlehandedly brings the place down with a DShK.Rocky stops all exports from K. G. F and starts hoarding gold. Andrews requests Adheera to kill Rocky. Rocky's aides trace his biological father, a drunkard who abandoned his family, and Rocky anoints the unaware man caretaker of his mother's newly shifted grave. He also gets married to Reena. Rocky meets with Sen and hands her a file exposing his involvement in money laundering but she cannot consider it as almost all her party members were complicit in the corruption.Adheera obtains information about a secret passage to K. G. F and informs Andrews. Adheera, Andrews, Daya, John and their gang attack K. G. F with Khalil's armada. Just as Reena announces her pregnancy to Rocky, Adheera fatally snipes her. In the ensuing clash, Rocky's army kill Andrews and Daya, while Rocky kills John and Adheera. Rocky and his henchmen disrupt Sen's resignation speech at the Parliament and kill Pandian. Pandian had staged the attack on Garuda for which Adheera was framed, and informed Adheera of Garuda's attack priorly. He was also the one who showed Adheera the secret passage, goaded Andrews into hiring Rocky, staged the no-confidence motion drama in Delhi and persuaded Shetty to join forces with Khalil just to gain Rocky's trust.Sen issues a death warrant against Rocky and enforces the Indian Army. Rocky evacuates K. G. F and leaves on a ship with his cache of gold. He signals the Navy to his location but refuses to surrender. Sen issues orders to bomb K. G. F and his ship. Rocky is killed and drowns in the ocean along with the gold, which stays lost till date. Before leaving, Rocky had formed a new colony for all K. G. F workers. A young Ingalagi decides to write a book on Rocky. In a mid-credits scene, three months post-Rocky's death, a CIA official hands over a file listing Rocky's crimes in United States and 16 other nations between 1978-1981 to Ramika Sen. In the present day, the peon of the television news channel finds the final draft of K. G. F: Chapter 3.

reviews.review_title: Why KGF is best in the league?
reviews.content: As we see antihero genre has been taking up a hold lately, but why? Answer is, it gives us an amazing dose of action packed sequences, heavy dialogues, protagonists hustle and all this packed with a beautifully written solid story arch which explains that why our antihero acts in a particular way.But when we see these movies we see alot of things put in as fillers which doesn't have much to do with story arch but have been placed just to make the movie a little more interesting and entertaining. Well that's not true with K. G. F 2. It serves as a well written well executed project which holds you to your seats and you just don't want to miss even a second in the journey. Amazing performances, great action sequences, and the touch of mother's love brings every thing to a solid conclusion. You might think that the ending could have been the other way around, but I think what happens does full justice to the role of our anti-hero Rocky.I just hope we get to see yash performing again as Rocky. Loved this masterpiece.

Unmatchable movie. Top notch story, top notch characters, top notch acting by everyone, top notch background music. People termed her as a villain but according to me her character is against the protagonist (who is engaged is criminal activities) which doesn't make her a villain I guess. Overall its a movie one should watch at least once in the theater and can watch multiple times because this movie has the potential to keep you on the edge everytime you watch this movie.

reviews.review_title: Decent Story but terrible dubbing. Waste of money to watch it in theatre
reviews.content: I watched K. G. F:Chapter 2 in Tamil and I found the story moving forward in a decent way. However, the story was not as engaging as it was in the prequel.Additionally, the dubbing in Tamil was terrible, most of the dubbing artists were speaking is such a deep voice that it was hard to make out what they were actually trying to say. There was no subtitles to compensate that.I would suggest the movie watchers to go and watch the movie in original language which is in Kannada or wait for the OTT release in Amazon Prime. Don't waste your money watching dubbed version in theatres.

Expectations surpassed!"Hindi viewers, please don't regret later on when it'll be playing on TV and internet." This is what I mentioned in my review of KGF Chapter 1 after I watched it in cinemas. And today, as I witnessed the second chapter of this epic action saga in cinemas as well, I found myself blown away by the gripping plot, gorgeous visuals, stunning action sequences and most importantly, Yash's screen presence as Rocky. I can safely proceed to state that my expectations were not only met, but also surpassed by this fine sequel.KGF Chapter 2 expands the scale and story introduced to us in part 1 and ends up raising the bar higher. The makers were definitely quite confident making it, and it shows in every single frame. From beautifully picturizing the KGF (Kolar Gold Fields) to explosively choreographing the action sequences to elevating Rocky's character at multiple occasions, they have shown they knew what the viewers wanted, and delivered the promise product without any hassle. I was also glad to see heavy cheering and whistling throughout almost the entire duration, and some credit goes to the dialogue writer as well. The music was also good and delivered without interfering with the storytelling (though one song in the second half wasn't really necessary).The biggest plus point of the film is its screenplay. From re-introducing our favorite characters and introducing new ones to building up conflicts and backing them with explosive action, KGF Chapter 2 has all the ingredients of a proper mass entertainer. Not a single scene where it feels dragged or overdone. Sure, it does feel long at times, but it never gets boring, and with several twists and turns, the story remains intriguing till the end.One thing I'd definitely want to tell the viewers is to not simply get up and walk away once the credits start rolling. There is a mid-credits scene, and it's an important one. Other than that, this film should be on your watchlist if you like period action films. In the end, I just feel glad and kind of proud seeing a film I liked in 2018 going on to receive much bigger hype and viewer turnout with its second part in 2022.166 out of 214 found this helpfulsriramthestranger14 April 2022

Warning: Spoilers
KGF - Chapter 1, set the tone for a slick gangster franchise-high on style and details. The first part was all about establishing the intentions and power of Raja Krishnappa Bairya aka Rocky Bhai. The second part has managed to create hype with its promotional content that gives a peek into the film. Does the film manage to match the build-up? It does and provides a better sequel and also has a big surprise for fans in the end, too.The film begins with Vijayendra Ingalagi, the son of Anand Ingalagi, taking over as the narrator. Rocky has won over the people of KGF and he is now in the process of dreaming bigger and treading more dangerous paths. In this process, he encounters Adheera, who is inspired by the Vikings and evokes visceral fear, who wants KGF back. Simultaneously, he also has to encounter the righteous Prime Minister Ramika Sen, who also wants Rocky taken down.The story progresses at a brisk pace in a racy tale of Rocky's journey to the top. The film, like the first part, presents a dark, dreary world that is stylishly shot. While the first part took time to prove who the protagonist was and included more time to establish the same, this second part moves quicker and one gets to meet more characters. The conflicts and battles are more interesting this time.This film gets to showcase the emotional side of Rocky too, with a love story and even some glimpses into his past life that fuelled his ambition. The love story doesn't take away too much from the tale either. One of the best shots in the film is the introduction of Adheera played by Sanjay Dutt. It is pure magic on screen and evokes whistles organically. Raveena Tandon as the Prime Minister also has a good track. The other interesting addition is Rao Ramesh as the CBI officer. Prakash Raj also makes for a good narrator, with his baritone adding an immersive experience.The film belongs as much to filmmaker Prashanth Neel as it does to Yash. Both of them have managed to deliver a sequel that seems more immersive than the first part. Albeit, Prashanth has always maintained that the second part had the bigger chunk of his original story when they decided to break it into two parts.For the audience who wants to watch a loaded action film with style, heavy-duty stunts, and dialogues, this one is simply made to order. KGF: Chapter 2 might not appeal to the seemingly woke audience, who would question consent or nitpick on commercial staples like violence. But for those who love such films, here's an essential spoiler, as there is a hint at a possible third chapter in the end credits, so wait until the end.

reviews.review_title: There is no Sigma like rocky
reviews.content: The people who fell in love with the first chapter, I can safely say that they are in for an absolute delight. It's bigger, better and more grand in the truest sense of the word! Prashant Neel knew what the fans wished for and he duly delivers. With electrifying Cinematography, phenomenal background score and a surplus of action set pieces, it's nothing but an Action Junky's dream come true.Regardless, speaking of my personal opinion on it, I did enjoy my time in the theatres, and did take a strong liking to whatever this had in its offerings; However, I wasn't fully sold on it.Halt the hate train and just let me clarify...I have mainly two criticisms, one is about the forceful incorporation of romance (which was mostly counterproductive) and the other one is a somewhat loose portrayal of Sanjay Dutt as "Adheera". Just try to remember what Prashant Neel previously did with Ramachandra Raju as Garuda. That character, not only looked ferocious and frightening he also talked evil, acted evil, and the whole aura around him was appalling to say the very least.Now when it comes to Adheera, the impression is quite distinct. Don't get me wrong, he still is efficient enough and Mr Dutt played the role remarkably well, it's just that his character appeared more like a murderous, bloodthirsty warrior (inspired by Viking traditions) than a vicious, vile adversary against our lead protagonist.For Srinidhi Shetty (as Reena); My qualms are a little different. I would not put the entire blame on her, as she did whatever the director had made her do. It's her character, or the writing rather, that leaves much to be desired. On a side note, I admire what they did with Ramika Sen; she's fierce, desperate and very much to the point. Needless to say, Raveena Tandon did an incredible job as well.Looking at how my review had gone so far, you guys might be having some doubts regarding my judgements, well, don't get any wrong ideas cause I wholeheartedly appreciate the film for what it is and what it represents. And the main reason for my fondness goes to Yash aka Rocky!I'm telling you, this man is something else. I have seen lots of superstars over the years but none come remotely close to what Yash brings to the table. His magnetic personality, the specific way in which he delivers his lines, and the undeniable charisma that he possesses; it's truly one of a kind, unparalleled in every sense.

KGF. Chapter 2 is a ridiculously entertaining adrenaline-pumping theatre experience and a satisfying feast for masala movie lovers.Director Prashanth Neel is incredible at making sure audience sees every penny of his budget on screen in the loudest possible way.Chapter 2 expands the scale and story introduced to us in chapter 1 and ends up raising the bar even higher. The makers were definitely quite confident making it, and it shows in every single frame. With electrifying cinematography, a phenomenal background score by Ravi Basrur, and beautifully crafted action set pieces, KGF 2 in its true sense is a Monster-piece. I still can't believe the fact that the entire movie was edited by a 19-year-old dude named Ujwal Kulkarni who created YouTube fan-boy edits. Hats Off.

Although KGF1 didn't have huge box office collection, it managed to garner the huge audience on OTT platforms. I loved KGF1. It had great storytelling, awesome BGM, and a right mix of emotions, hope and suspense. And also it had a perfect ending with plenty of scope for a sequel.The awesome teaser and the trailers of KGF2 had created humongous hype.Oh, boy! I'm so disappointed with KGF2. It felt rushed, lacked depth, and filled with gimmicky action scenes. The movie was so loud that it made me numb and at times had to close my ears.In KGF1, Rocky's acts were justified as he had a motive to set free the slaves by taking down Garuda. reviews.review_title: A high octane gangster flick , towering monster of a saga!!
reviews.content: An ode to Indian cinema.We have all been there with gargantuan scripts, experienced the grandeur with epic films like Baahubali ; whereas KGF revels as a relatively modern day gangster flick.Cinema being a multidimensional medium provides an immersive experience. KGF does that to the seeker. Its immersive ability takes the audience to a zenith that pretty much most of Indian cinema has only dreamt of. The movie besides its bells and whistles , is a benchmark to the technical abilities of cinematic prowess.The script is an high octane filled drama that sweeps ones feet as a Scarface saga. As a movie it is a feast and a festival like none other.As the main character, Rocky (Actor Yash) is the king who literally sways us with his swag like Rajnikanth and bloodshot demeanor of angry young man Amitabh. As Rocky Bhai , given his voracious appetite to control the gold empire, Yash is menacingly an unstoppable juggernaut. His ambitions are madly bolstered by a riveting screenplay, monstrous visuals and a background score that seamlessly lends to the cause.Except for a few movies, Bollywood with its utterly decrepit scripts could never do justice to the talent of Sanjay Dutt. KGF unearths Sanju Baba's volcanic persona with its Magnum opus. We get to witness his full potential and also get to assuage those Vikings/epic drama characters through him.Raveena Tandon with her notable presence gives a stellar performance. She has very few scenes but they speak volumes of her ability.Not to mention all the other key figures from the mother (Archana Jois) to actress Srinidhi to everyone else. The mother character is pivotal as it tethers to the emotional connect in this movie and Archana Jois bares her soul. Srinidhi illusively embodies the arm candy in a certain measure yet she is magnificent and marks us with her presence .At the climax, the face off scenes between Yash and Sanju are just high octane moments. This movie is a visual feast that gets supplemented with a mesmerized background score.As a viewer the movie is an answer to ones prayers, the longing to derive perennial entertainment. Overall this is the Indian Avengers moment of its kind, our very own super hero universe. Personally speaking, Yash is not only going to lord this universe but Prashant Neel sets the bar very high for Indian cinema.

reviews.review_title: As per expectation full of power full of action.
reviews.content: Yes some story plot is missing like how kill other and chepter 1 visible person. Thank God this movie not contain like Rrr overrated action ( bike scene and other 😂 ) so hope everyone love that movie bcz I think this mv series better than bahubali series.

For me KGF Chapter 2 failed to impress, is primarily because of bollywood actors.Raveena Tandon super over acted trying to portray her as a determined figure.Chapter 1 had its impression through new faces and showing everyone equally powerful delivering impactful performances.The film is surely filled with supreme love for machoism and dominance. So was KGF-1, but it was a good presentation and entertainer.Also to the critics of machoism, the film is shown to be a old story that is being narrated. It's the old Indian machoism that's displayed.Chapter 1 had some very good silence for the villains which made their performance powerful.Proper placement of powerful music added the charm to chapter 1.Over-all the chapter 2 is not at par with chapter 1.

Finally, India came with their own God Father movie. KGF is much better than Godfather. Anyhow, we don't want to compare KGF with other movies because it has left own trademark which won't be easy to overcome for another 50 years.The Theatre sound system was terrific. It was giving a glimpse of Bourne Identity movie action sound system. I have never seen such kind of loud sound system in my life.KGF is going to rule.KGF needs the Chapter 3 and chapter 4.

I've watched the Hindi-dubbed version and found it to be PERFECT!To the logical mind, the movie just won't make any sense. But if you accept the fact that Prashanth Neel has created a universe where characters are driven by emotions and that they take actions based on the demand of the situations they're in, you're in for a ride. You'll then realise that everything and everyone are in sync with their roles in this universe.The film revolves around Rocky and his objective of fulfilling his dead mom's last wish of dying rich and powerful. He doesn't care how it happens-such is his love for his mother that he doesn't mind bending the rules and going against the law of the land to realise his goal. In that sense, he's flawed and an anti-hero, and that's what makes him so interesting and intriguing. I daresay he's one of the best-written characters in the history of Indian cinema. He's multifaceted, complex, twisted, and brilliantly layered. He's also extremely foresighted. It's as if Rocky was a distinct person that finally got projected onto the screen!Speaking of Yash's performance, Yash is Rocky. The guy embodies Rocky to the extent that nobody else can play him. It'd be difficult to see anyone but Yash as this iconic character. I hope he sweeps all the Best Actor awards for his work.Sanjay Dutt as Adheera is scary and menacing, and I wish he had more screen time. But then, if the story demands only so much of his presence, it's fine by me.Raveena Tandon as PM Ramika Sen has delivered her career-best performance. I really can't wait to see her again in KGF: Chapter 3!Everyone else has done their job equally well.The love-angle issue that many are pointing out could have been resolved by giving more dialogue to Srinidhi's Reena, but I guess the makers didn't feel much need for it, as they trusted the actor to emote those parts. Personally, I felt she conveyed her inner emotions well, and if you get a good sense of how Prashanth Neel's unique universe works, you'd understand Reena's actions and motivations better.The direction and screenplay are top-notch. There's so much going on in the film that I totally got my money's worth! Each scene has been crafted with perfection and precision. Staying true to its title, the film ensures the most amount of empathy for the people of KGF rather than for Rocky alone. It's when he does something for these people that we feel the empathy for him. It's when he doesn't forget about them in his quest that we feel something for him. At least that's what I felt.The cinematography is fantastic, and the BGM is goosebump-inducing. The editing, with those black cuts, suited the film's mood and tone. The set design is out of this world, and as for the VFX, I wonder whether it was even there because everything looked so real! Everything in the film has been dialed up to the highest notch, and rightly so, given the film's genre, setting, and scale. Anything under, and the film would have failed to impress.Overall, KGF: Chapter 2 is a must-have big-screen experience. I'm looking forward to catching it again on both the big and small screen. The movie has such a haunting quality to it that it makes me want to revisit it again and again. The Nanare Naro Nare Nare Na lullaby is especially mesmerising.Watch it, and allow your subconscious to unpack the movie in the hours and days after. There are so many symbolisms, metaphors, and connections at play that I was simply amazed. I could see how each and every moment in the film has a context to it and how the movie has several hidden connections with Chapter 1 that aren't too obvious immediately. At the same time, if you're someone who insists on political correctness in books, films, etc., you'd have a hard time digesting this stuff. I'm no fan of PC, and I detest the word, "practical," so I could enjoy this film undeterred.I highly recommend KGF: Chapter 2. Not merely as a movie, but as a distinct experience that is rare to find in Indian cinema.

Such a masterpiece. The direction and script by Prashant Neel, the acting from Yash and the crew, the cinematography by Bhuvan Gowda and the legendary background score by Ravi Basrur. This movie is the pinnacle of technical movie making 😍🔥

There are a couple of things to keep in mind while watching this movie. Firstly, this genre of movie is not meant to please everyone. Some might feel senseless action and flying cars which do not obey the laws of physics. This movie is not for the hypercritical. This movie has a very unique factor which is the strength of this film, which is the entertainment factor. Go to this movie leaving your physics book at home to watch fantastic visuals and very quirky conflict-ions which you might not get to see in any other genre. The strong points of this movie are Cinematography, BGM, and over the top dialogues. It is hyper dramatic and loud. But that is the style of this movie . It is more like a graphic novel made with real life action setting. Definitely go and watch this movie with your gang to have a ball , chill out, experience the bloody, cool and over the top action film like you enjoy a DWAYNE JOHNSON film. Don't try to make sense of it's quirkiness. That is the point of the movie .

No one know what lies in 20000 ft of ocean yet they cant recover it from depths.As KGF2 start with conversation with his maa, she tell a prince in gilter sea and also rocky promise his maa that he will fetch all the gold to her.In KGF 3 you will see rocky will swim from sea as i seen lot of movie this type of scene. And in first half there will be crime of rocky done in America or india during 1978-81. But in second half of movie there will be grand entry of Rocky bhai and his journey with his gold. reviews.content: Mind-blowing What I saw on screen was the conviction and hardwork of the entire team that has worked with so much passion!! 👏🏻👏🏻👏🏻 Congrats on the well deserved humongous success.
